Ella desea este crédito con el objetivo de realizar compras variadas de sus productos, ya que quiere empezar a vender más. Además, aduce la señora, cada día los precios de los productos están cada día más caros. Este se ha convertido en un desafió para ella, debido a que la situación económica del país cada día está más difícil.
texts.en: Jacinta de los Ángeles is 34 and has two small children. She runs a small store from her home, selling staples, candy, detergent, matches, cigarettes, bread and milk.  She has managed her business for the past 7 years, and started it to generate household income to better care for her children.  She seeks this credit to buy varied merchandise to stock and to increase sales.  She notes that every day prices seem to increase, and this is challenge for her business amidst the current difficult economic situation of her country.

loans.use: to buy staples, candy, detergent, matches, cigarettes, bread and milk

loans.name: Nueva Generacion Tlahuelilpan Group

texts.es: El grupo se llama "NUEVA GENERACION TLAHUELILPAN" ya que las integrantes  se sienten parte de una nueva y latente generacion  de mujeres  emprendedoras que  estan en busca de una superacion economica y personal que les permita obtener una mejor calidad de vida. El grupo esta ubicado en el estado de Hidalgo en Mexico. Esta conformado por 10 integrantes. La señora Soledad es integrante de este grupo, ella tiene 51 años de edad y solo estudio la primaria. Es comerciente y tiene como actividad principal la venta de plantas. Desde que inicio hace 6 años este negocio ha obtenido buenos resultados como un ingreso que le permite cubrir sus necesidades hasta la satisfaccion de sentirse una persona productiva. Ella comenta que los prestamos que le otorguen serán un importante impulso para poder hacer crecer su negocio. Con el prestamo que le otorguen va a invertirlo en mas variedad de plantas y flores que le solicitan sus clientes y pedidos que ya tienen realizados. Ha generado confianza entre sus clientes ofreciendo productos de calidad y un buen servicio por lo que siempre la recomiendan. Con las ganancias que obtenga lo utilizara para apoyar a su esposo en los gastos familiares y para ofrecerle una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
This group is called 'Nueva Generación Tlahuelilpan' as its members feel that they form part of a new, emerging generation of entrepreneurial women who are in search of financial and personal improvement which will allow them to achieve a better quality of life.  The group is located in the State of Hidalgo, in Mexico, and has ten members.

Soledad is a member of this group.  She is 51 years old and only studied to elementary school level.  She is a retailer and her main business activity is selling plants.  Since she started out in this business six years ago, she has obtained good results and income which allows her to cover her needs.  She also has the satisfaction of feeling productive.  She tells us that the loans that she receives will be a very important driving force in enabling her to grow her business.  She will invest this loan in buying a wider range of plants and flowers that her customers are requesting.  She will also fill some orders that she currently has.  Soledad has gained the trust of her customers by selling good-quality products and providing good customer service.  As a result, her customers are always recommending her.  With the profits that she makes, Soledad will support her husband with their family expenses and offer her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to invest in plants and flowers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase construction materials for home improvements.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy shoes, sheets, towels, perfumes, skin creams and cologne

loans.name: Angela

texts.es:
La señora Ángela tiene 56 años de edad, está casada con el señor florentino, tienen 2 hijos Juan y librada, quienes ya están casados y tiene su propia familia, ella se dedica a la venta de semillas como son: frijol y maíz, desde hace mas de 25 años, para tener un poco mas surtido su negocio.
Ella decidió iniciar con este negocio, buscando apoyar a su esposo con los gastos de la casa y a su familia, también para mejorar un poco mas su solvencia económica y asegurar su futuro, ya que son un poco mayores, el crédito que recibió decidió invertirlo en la compra de mas semillas como son: maíz, frijol y semillas de calabaza.
El deseo más grande que tiene doña Ángela para su negocio, es de incrementar su inversión, para hacer crecer rápidamente su negocio, ya que quisiera poner una bodega de compra y venta de semillas, para así mejorar e incrementar aún más sus ganancias, y apoyar a su familia.
Esta muy satisfecha por contar con el apoyo de los donadores de kiva, ya que gracias a esto ahora goza de una mejor producción y surtido en el negocio, que le ayuda, para ir apoyando a su familia y continuar ahorrando algo de sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Ángela is 56 and is married to Florentino.  They have two children, Juan and Librada, who are already married and have their own families.  She sells seeds, such as corn and bean, which she has been doing for more than 25 years.  She started this business to help her husband and family with day-to-day expenses so as to improve their economic situation a bit and make their future more secure, especially now that they are getting older.  The money she receives will be invested in increasing her stock of seeds, such as corn, bean, and squash seeds.

Ángela would like to increase her working capital so that her business can grow rapidly, as she would like to have a store to buy and sell seeds; this would offer her the chance to improve and increase her income even further and thus help her family.  She is very grateful for the assistance she receives from Kiva donors, which allows her to enjoy better production and to grow her business, so she can support her family and save some of her income for the future.

loans.use: to buy more corn, bean, and squash seeds for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase footwear to sell in her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for materials and labor in order to make home improvements.

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es:
La señora Isabel tiene 34 años de edad y está casada con el señor Juan Bonifacio, con el cual tiene 5 hijos, Yadira, Juan Carlos, yahir, Alexander y Alexis, de los cuales solo 4 estudian, la mayor está cursando el primer año de prepa, uno más segundo año de secundaria, otro quinto año de primaria y el más pequeño segundo año de preescolar, ya que el menor apenas tiene 4 meses de edad, ella tiene una tienda de abarrotes desde hace mas de 4 años.
Dice que decidió invertir en esta actividad, porque quería ayudar a su esposo con los gastos de la casa ya que veía que trabajaba demasiado en el campo y no ganaba lo suficiente, para tener una buena solvencia económica, también para continuar apoyando a sus hijos con sus estudios, para que puedan tener una muy buena carrera profesional, el crédito que recibió lo va a invertir en la compra de mas productos como son: leche, aceite, azúcar, refrescos, sal, arroz, jabón, etc. para así tener un poco mas surtida su tienda.
Una de las metas que tiene, para su tienda doña Isabel, es la de hacerla crecer muchísimo, ya que está pensando en mas a delante construir un local, para tener más surtido su negocio y así mejorar e incrementar mucho mas sus ingresos, ya que estos les serán de mucha utilidad, puesto que seguir apoyando a su esposo e hijos.
Le da la gracias a fundación realidad y a los donadores de kiva por todo el apoyo y confianza que le están brindando, ya que esto le ha servido de mucho, puesto que ahora puede continuar invirtiendo en su negocio y apoyar a su familia.
texts.en:
Isabel is 34 years old and married to Juan Bonifacio.  The couple have five children: Yadira, Juan Carlos, Yahir, Alexander and Alexis.  Four of their children are in school.  Their eldest [daughter] is in her first year of high school, their next child is in his second year of middle school, another is in his fifth year of elementary school and another is in his second year of pre-school.  Their youngest is just four months old.  Isabel has owned a grocery store for more than four years.

Isabel says that she decided to invest in this business because she wanted to help her husband with their household expenses as she saw that he was working too much in the fields and wasn't earning enough for them to be really financially stable.  She also wanted to continue supporting her children in their studies so that they could have a very good professional career.  She will invest her loan in buying more products such as milk, oil, sugar, soft drinks, salt, rice, soap, etc. so that she can stock her store a little more.

One of Isabel's goals for her store is to make it grow a lot as she is planning, in the future, to build special premises so that she can further stock her business and thereby improve and much further increase her income.  This will be very useful as she will be able to continue supporting her husband and her children.

Isabel thanks Fundación Realidad and Kiva lenders for all their support and the trust that they are placing in her.  They have helped her a lot as she is  able to continue investing in her business and supporting her family.

loans.use: to buy more products such as milk, oil, sugar, soft drinks, salt, rice, soap, etc.

loans.name: Fiorella

texts.es:
Fiorella de 21 años de edad, es soltera, vive en casa de sus padres, cuenta con servicio sólo de luz, ubicada en el distrito de Tambogrande que pertenece al departamento de Piura.  Esta zona se caracteriza por ser agrícola, ganadería y artesanía.

Fiorella tiene como actividad laboral la confección y venta de prendas de vestir, desde hace un año, su negocio lo tiene en el domicilio de sus padres, cuenta con su propia clientela y también realiza trabajos a pedidos, la competencia en el rubro no es mucha, con los ingresos que obtenga podrá cubrir sus necesidades personales.  También cría y comercializa aves de corral y así obtiene otro ingreso para la casa.

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa mediante Capital Semilla de 800 para comprar material y alimento balanceado para sus aves de corral,  así pueda seguir brindando un buen servicio y cumpliendo con los pedidos que le han hecho, lo que le permitirá tener más ganancias para mejorar su calidad de vida.  Fiorella con mucho esfuerzo y trabajo a sabido sacar su negocio adelante,  para seguir ayudando económicamente a sus padres y más adelante realizar estudios para mejorar como costurera.
texts.en:
Fiorella is 21 years old, single, and lives in a house that only has electricity with her parents, located in the Tambogrande district in the department of Piura. This area is known for agriculture, livestock and handcrafts. 

Fiorella has been making and selling clothing since last year. Her business is in her parent’s home. She has her own clients and she also takes work requests. She does not have much competition in this area and the income that she gets covers her personal needs. She also breeds and sells poultry as another source of income.

She is asking for an 800 nuevos soles loan ($300.00) from Edpyme Alternativa in order to buy supplies so she can continue providing good service and to complete the orders she has, and for food for her poultry, allowing her to have a higher income in order to provide a better quality of life. 

Fiorella has been able to move her business forward with a lot of work and effort, which has allowed her to continue helping her parents financially and to become a better seamstress.

loans.use: to purchase supplies in order to continue making clothing, and to buy feed for her poultry

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase materials for home improvements.

loans.name: Laura Maria

texts.es:
Laura es una madre de familia de 38 años, vive con sus 2 hijas en su casa propia, cuenta con servicio de agua y luz, ubicada en el distrito de Casa Grande que pertenece al departamento de La Libertad.  Esta zona se caracteriza por ser agrícola, ganadera y turismo.

La actividad que desarrolla Laura es la venta de carne de pollo en el interior del mercado de Casa Grande, su negocio lo tiene desde hace 8 años, cuenta con su propia clientela y es conocida por el buen producto que ofrece, con los ingresos de sus ventas podrá cubrir sus necesidades de su familia.

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1000 nuevos soles para comprar más carne de pollo para seguir satisfaciendo la necesidad de sus clientes, al aumentar sus ventas podrá pagar su crédito otorgado y mejorar la calidad de vida y las oportunidades de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Laura is a 38-year-old mother who lives with her two daughters in her own home which has water and electricity.  Her home is located in Casa Grande district, in La Libertad department.  This area is noted for its farming, livestock raising and tourism.

Laura's business is selling chicken [meat] inside Casa Grande market.  She has had her business for eight years.  She has her own customer base and is well known for the good-quality product that she offers.  She uses the income from her sales to cover her family's needs.

Laura has requested a loan for 1,000 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa to buy more chicken so that she can continue meeting her customers' needs and increase her sales so that she can repay her loan and improve her children's quality of life and opportunities.

loans.use: to buy more chicken to sell

loans.name: Claudia Maria

texts.es: Claudia tiene 31 años, tiene 1 hijo  y vive con ella y le ayuda en lo que puede con su negocio. Su actividad principal es la venta de ropa nueva. El negocio se encuentra de forma ambulante, por lo que todos los días sale a vender los diferentes productos que tiene. Ella realiza su actividad por pedidos y debido a la calidad de productos que ofrece su negocio cada vez está creciendo más, sus pedidos están aumentando y esto ha hecho que piense en ampliar. Ella es una mujer emprendedora y que toda su vida ha velado por el bienestar de los suyos. El financiamiento que solicita es para la compra de pantalones, trajes, ropa interior, camisas, faldas,  entre otros.
texts.en:
Claudia is 31 years old and has one son who lives with her.  She helps him as far as she can with her business.  Her main business activity is selling new clothes.  She carries out her business as an itinerant vendor and goes out every day to sell her different products.  Claudia works to order and, owing to the quality of the products that she sells, her business is growing, her orders are increasing and so she is planning to expand.

Claudia is an entrepreneurial woman who has spent her entire life looking out for her family's well-being.  She is requesting this loan to buy pants, dresses, underwear, shirts, skirts, etc.

loans.use: to buy pants, dresses, underwear, shirts, skirts, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to expand his premises and buy furniture

loans.name: Pascual Benjamin

texts.es: Este cliente es un pequeño agricultor que solicita crédito para la compra de insumos agrícolas para el establecimiento de dos manzanas de maíz, la zona objeto de inversión se trata de suelos aptos para el cultivo este es el crédito numero dos que solicita los que paga una vez levantada la cosecha, es casado y padre de un hijo en edad escolar.
texts.en:
This client is a small farmer who is requesting a loan to buy farming supplies. This will help him establish two plots of corn. The land that will be cultivated is suitable for this crop.

This is the second loan he has requested and will be repaid once his crop is harvested. He is married and the father of a school-age child.

loans.use: to purchase farming supplies such as urea, herbicides, and insecticides for growing corn.

loans.name: Reynaldo

texts.es:
A la vivienda del señor Raynaldo le está haciendo falta los acabados del exterior.
Solicita un préstamo para poder comprar el material (cemento, arena, pintura especial para el exterior, y pagarle a la persona) que se encargara de realizar la mejora. 
Desea que su familia tenga un lugar seguro y en buenas condiciones para vivir y así también poder evitar enfermedades. 
Don Reynaldo planea pagar el crédito con el sueldo que recibe de su trabajo como guardia de seguridad de una compañía, ya que su esposa la señora Damaris se encargara de los gastos familiares con el ingreso que obtiene de su trabajo como empleada de una agencia.
texts.en:
Reynaldo's home needs some finishing work done to the outside.  He is requesting a loan to buy materials (cement, sand, special outdoor paint) and to pay the person who will carry out the work.

Reynaldo would like his family to have a safe place, in good condition, in which to live so that they can avoid illnesses.

Reynaldo plans to repay his loan with the salary that he earns from his job as a security guard for a company.  His wife, Damaris, will take care of the family expenses with the income that she earns from her job as an office employee.

loans.use: to do some finishing work to the outside of his home

loans.name: Osvalda

texts.es:
Osvalda D. 60 años D. edad, es viuda, vive en su casa propia, cuenta con todos los servicios básicos, ubicada en la zona urbana del distrito D. José Leonardo Ortiz que pertenece a la provincia D. Chiclayo.  Esta zona se caracteriza porla actividad comercial y D. servicio público.

Osvalda se dedica a la comercialización D. todo tipo D. menestras en un puesto que tiene en el mercado Moshoqueque, su negocio abre todos los días desD. hace 5 años, tiene su clientela y se a hecho conocida por el buen producto que ofrece a sus clientes, con los ingresos que obtenga podrá solventar sus necesidades diarias.

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa D. 3000 nuevos soles para la compra D. más menestra y seguir vendiendola a otros comerciantes y con sus ganancias cubrirá su crédito y mejorará su calidad D. vidaen su casa.  Osvalda a pesar D. su edad todos los días atienD. a sus clientes con respeto, alegría y con las ganas D. seguir trabajando para seguir mejorando.
texts.en:
60-year-old Osvalda is a widow.  She lives in her own home which has all basic services.  It is located in the urban area of José Leonardo Ortiz district, in the province of Chiclayo.  This area is noted for its commercial and public service activity.

Osvalda sells all kinds of pulses (legumes) from a stall that she has in Moshoqueque market.  Her business has been open every day for the past five years.  She has her own customer base and has become known for the good-quality products that she offers her customers.  She uses her income to cover her daily needs.

Osvalda has requested a loan for 3,000 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa to buy more pulses (legumes) which she will continue selling to other vendors.  She will use her profits to repay her loan and improve her quality of life at home.  In spite of her age, Osvalda serves her customers every day with cheerfulness and respect.  She has the desire to continue working so that she can continue improving.

loans.use: to buy more pulses (legumes) to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy products for preparing meals

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy products for his business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for his educational expenses.

loans.name: Teresa Del Carmen

texts.es:
La señora Teresa del Carmen se ha destacado por ser una persona muy dedicada a su trabajo debido a que ha sabido llevar el sustento a su casa y familia y ha logrado mantener a su amada familia en mejores condiciones. Ella se caracteriza por ser una excelente trabajadora y con altos valores lo cual ha hecho que se gane el aprecio de muchas personas en su municipio. 

Actualmente ha acudido a Ceprodel con el fin de solicitar un crédito para mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda, para ello está solicitando el crédito, para la compra de materiales de construcción, tales como zinc y perlines para iniciar la mejora del techo de su casa.
texts.en:
Sra. Teresa del Carmen is known for being a person who is very dedicated to her work.  Teresa has provided for the welfare of her home and her family.  She has managed to maintain the family that she loves and believes in providing better conditions.  Teresa is known as an excellent worker with good values, thus enabling her to earn the respect of many people around town.  

She came to the CEPRODEL branch in El Sauce to request a loan so that she could improve the condition of her home.  The loan she requested will be used to buy construction materials, such as plywood and crossbeams, in order to repair the roof of her house.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials for repairing the roof of her house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase furniture for his recreational bar

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for materials and labor so that the roof of his house can be repaired.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase construction materials for home improvements.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, and bricks so that he can build an extension to his house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for materials and labor in order to make home improvements.

loans.name: Manuel De Jesús

texts.es: Este cliente es un pequeño productor que se dedica al cultivo de granos básicos específicamente maíz, es viudo y no tiene ningún hijo a su cargo solicita crédito para la compra de insumos agrícolas la zona de inversión es apta para este cultivo con la institución es el crédito numero tres que solicita y espera continuar trabajando para mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
This client is a small producer who cultivates basic grains, specifically corn. He is a widower and does not have any children to support.

He is requesting a loan to buy farming supplies. The area where he is planting is suitable for this crop. With this third loan that he is requesting from CEPRODEL, he hopes to continue working so that he can improve the living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to purchase farming supplies for growing corn.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cement and sand and to pay labor costs.

loans.name: Dominga Francisca

texts.es:
La Señorea Dominga Francisca se ha caracterizado por ser una persona muy trabajador debido a que ha sabido llevar el bien estar de su casa y a logrado mantener a su familia que tanto ama y Estima en mejores condiciones. Ella se caracteriza por ser una excelente trabajadora y con buenos valores morales ha hecho que se gane el aprecio de muchas personas de su municipio. 
 Actual mente a acudido a Ceprodel El Sauce, con el fin de solicitar un crédito para ampliar las condiciones de su vivienda, para ello está solicitando el crédito, para la compra de materiales de construcción, tales como: Arena, Sementó, ladrillo y sin  con esto empezara a la construcción de un anexo a su vivienda (Cocina), para las mejores condiciones de su familia.
texts.en:
Mrs. Dominga Francisca G. is notable in the town for being a very hardworking person who has known how to provide wellbeing for her home and managed to keep her family that she so loves and is fond of in the best possible living conditions.  She is noted for being an excellent worker with high moral standards that have led to her being held in high regard by many people in her town.

She came by Ceprodel-El Sauce to request a loan to enlarge her home.  This is the reason she’s asking for the loan: to buy building materials and supplies like: sand, cement, bricks and metal sheeting to start adding on to her home (kitchen) to improve her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to buy sand, cement, bricks and metal sheeting.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cement, sand and metal sheeting.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for materials and labor in order to make home improvements.

loans.name: Ada Ruth

texts.es: La señorea Ada Ruth atraviesa la necesidad de invertir en la mejora de su vivienda debido a que ha estado en malas condiciones y por ello requiere comprar materiales de construcción, tales como Arena, cementó, ladrillo y el pago de mano de obra, Cabe mencionar que  ella es una mujer muy preocupada por el bienestar de su hogar y es por eso que con el crédito empezará la mejora de su vivienda para así proporcionarle mejores condiciones a su familia en su municipio.
texts.en:
Mrs. Ada Ruth is notable for being a very hardworking person who has known how to provide wellbeing for her home and managed to keep her family that she so loves and is fond of in the best possible living conditions.  She is noted for being an excellent worker with high moral standards that have led to her being held in high regard by many people in her town.

She came by Ceprodel-El Sauce to request a loan to enlarge her home.  This is the reason she’s asking for the loan: to buy building materials and supplies like: sand, cement, bricks and metal sheeting and to pay labor costs to start making home improvements to better her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, bricks and metal sheeting.

loans.name: Mayra Del Socorro

texts.es:
En el Municipio de Santa Rosa del peñón, departamento de león, la Señorea Mayra Del Socorro  Se ha caracterizado por ser una persona muy trabajador debido a que ha sabido llevar el bien estar de su casa y a logrado mantener a su familia en buenas condiciones. Ella se caracteriza por ser una excelente trabajadora y con buenos valores morales ha hecho que se gane el aprecio de muchas personas de su municipio, cuenta con tres hijos bajo su cargo. 
 Actual mente  acudió a Ceprodel El Sauce, con el fin de solicitar un crédito para ampliar las condiciones de su vivienda, para ello está solicitando el crédito, para la compra de materiales de construcción, tales como: Arena, Sementó, ladrillo y Pago de mano de Obra con esto empezara a la Mejora de su vivienda, para así alcanzar las mejores condiciones de su familia.
texts.en:
Sra. Mayra Del Socorro lives in the town of Santa Rosa del Peñon in the Department of León. She is known for being a hardworking individual who knows how to provide for the welfare of her home. Mayra has managed to maintain good conditions for her family. She is known for being an excellent worker with good values, thus enabling her to earn the respect of many people around town. Mayra has three dependent children.

She came to the CEPRODEL branch in El Sauce to request a loan so that she could improve the condition of her home. The loan she requested will be used to buy construction materials such as sand, cement, and bricks. She will also pay for labor so that the improvements to her home can begin, thus making the way for better conditions for her family.

loans.use: to pay for materials and labor in order to make home improvements.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cement and sand for making home improvements.

loans.name: Conchita

texts.en:
Conchita is 59 years old and a widow with two children.

Conchita works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. 

Conchita has borrowed and repaid two loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for 11 years and also earns an income from rice retailing.

Conchita aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy items to sell.

loans.name: Julia Emperatriz

texts.es:
En el Municipio de Santa Rosa del Peñón, departamento de León, la Señora Julia Emperatriz se ha caracterizado por ser una persona muy trabajadora debido a que ha sabido llevar el bienestar a su casa y ha logrado mantener a su familia que tanto ama y aprecia en mejores condiciones. Ella se caracteriza por ser una excelente trabajadora y con buenos valores morales ha hecho que se gane el aprecio de muchas personas de su municipio. 
Actual mente se presentó a Ceprodel con el fin de solicitar un crédito para mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda, para ello está solicitando el crédito, para la compra de materiales de construcción tales como hierro y perlines ya que esto le permitirá mejorar el techo de su casa.
texts.en:
Mrs. Julia Emperatriz M. M. is notable in the town of Santa Rosa del Peñón, León Department, for being a very hardworking person who has known how to provide wellbeing for her home and managed to keep her family that she so loves and is fond of in the best possible living conditions.  She is noted for being an excellent worker with high moral standards that have led to her being held in high regard by many people in her town.

She came by Ceprodel-El Sauce to request a home improvement loan.  This is the reason she’s asking for the loan: to buy building materials and supplies like: iron rods and purlines to start repairing the roof on her house.

loans.use: to buy iron rods, purlines and sand.

loans.name: Salomón

texts.es: Este cliente es un pequeño agricultor que se dedica al cultivo de granos básicos tales como maíz, frijol y trigo, está solicitando para la compra de insumos tales como urea, completo insecticida y pago de mano de obra, es casado y de oficio agrónomo y los créditos los solicita al vencimiento para pagar una vez que la cosecha se haya levantado y comercializada.
texts.en:
This client is a small farmer who grows basic staples such as corn, beans, and wheat. He is requesting a loan so that he can buy supplies such as urea, insecticides, as well as pay for labor. He is married and has been in the agricultural trade.

The loans he has requested have been repaid as soon as his crops are harvested and sold.

loans.use: to purchase farming supplies and to pay for labor.

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia is 56 years old and a widow with six children.

She earns a living by raising livestock in the Philippines. Delia is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy additional livestock and feed for her business.

Delia has been raising livestock for 11 years and also earns additional income from food vending.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy additional livestock and  feed for her business.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane is a married. Mary Jane is 37 years old and lives in Bonifacio, Missamis Occidental.

Mary Jane sells dried fish to earn a living and has had this business for three years. Each month she earns 10,000 PHP doing this type of business. She has requested a loan for 5,000 PHP for this business.

Mary Jane has been a member of PMPC for almost two years. In the future, Mary Jane hopes to invest in more retail and to earn twice the profit of the loan.

loans.use: to purchase dried fish for her retail business

loans.name: Maria Clelia

texts.es: Maria  Clelia, D. treinta y nueve años D. edad vive en casa D. un familiar, en zona urbana, junto a su esposo y su menor hija, el pariente les ha cedido el derecho D. habitarla gratuitamente y sólo con obligación D. cuidarla, gracias a esta gran ayuda son varios años los que llevan D. vivir D. esa forma. Ella ha aprovechado el tiempo D. vivir en esta zona D. mucho comercio para dedicarse a la fabricación D. ricos tamales D. gallina en la misma casa, lo que la ha distinguido por más D. 10 años en la zona. Ahora Clelia recientemente se encuentra comerciando con productos D. belleza vía venta por catálogo D. varias marcas reconocidas, esta versátil mujer tiene tiempo aún para dedicarse al cuido D. su hija, ella se esmera cada fin D. semana para elaborar sus ricos tamales, desD. muy temprano compra los insumos frescos para la preparación D. los mismos y tenerlos listos para su reparto D. forma ambulante y por ella misma en lugares cercanos a su localidad. D. lunes a viernes ella se concentra entre sus habituales actividades D. ama D. casa y la visita a potenciales clientes D. los productos por revista que normalmente son lociones, cremas, shampoos, y otros mas D. belleza. Clelia a encontrando en éste último negocio una importante oportunidad para poder obtener mayores ingresos y colaborar con los ingresos del hogar, es por esto que decidió solicitar a INTEGRAL un préstamo con el que pueda comprar mayor cantidad D. productos D. belleza solicitados por los clientes e insumos para preparación D. tamales que son: gallina, maíz, tomates, especies y gas propano. Espera poder contar con esta importante ayuda y continuar colaborando con el sostenimiento económico D. su familia.
texts.en: Maria  Clelia, age 39, lives with her husband and their young daughter in the home of a family member in an urban area. The relation has allowed them to live there for free and only requires them to keep the place up. This is a great help and they have lived this way for several years. Maria Clelia has taken advantage of living in this highly commercial zone in making rich chicken tamales in her home. This has set her apart in the area for over ten years. Clelia has recently started selling beauty products from various well-known brands through a catalogue. This versatile woman still has time to take care of her daughter. She puts a lot of effort every weekend into making her rich tamales. She buys the fresh ingredients very early in the morning so that she can have the tamales ready to sell in the streets. She sells them herself in areas close to her home. From Monday to Friday she focuses on her regular duties as a housewife.  She also visits potential clients for her cosmetics, which normally incluD.: lotions, creams, shampoos and other beauty products. This cosmetics business has given Clelia an important opportunity to obtain more income and help out with the household costs. For this reason, she has decided to request a loan from INTEGRAL. With it, she will be able to buy a greater quantity of beauty products which her clients are requesting, as well as ingredients for making tamales: chicken, corn, tomatoes, spices, and propane gas. She hopes to be able to count on this important assistance and to continue helping to support her family.

loans.use: to purchase beauty products and ingredients for making tamales: chicken, corn, tomatoes, spices, and propane gas.

loans.name: Mwanaisha

texts.en:
Mwanaisha is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past ten years, she has operated a water selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality. During dry hot season the availability of water is low compared to high demand. She dreams of installing a big water tank in the future.

With the 20000 KES she wants to pay school fees for her children. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business and educate her children.

loans.use: To pay school fees for her children.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy is 38 years old and lives in upper Salug Daku, Mahayag, Zamboanga del Sur. She is married with four  children.
  
 Mercy  has a general store to earn a living and has had this business for fifteen years. Each month she earns PHP 10,000 doing this type of work. She has requested a loan for PHP 4,000.00 to purchase more products for her general store.

 Mercy has been a member of PMPC for two years. In the future, Mercy hopes to provide for the needs and wants of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more products for her general store.

loans.name: Mesalimu

texts.en: Mesalimu is widowed with five children, all of whom have graduated from school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped-in water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for her family. For the past five years, she has made a living selling fish to her neighbors at a local market. Her main challenge is the seasonality of her business and fluctuating prices, but this does not prevent her from dreaming of expanding her business in the future. She is applying for a loan for Kshs 40,000 to buy bundles of fish to sell, and has joined Yehu to access loans that will allow her to boost her business.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Mwanajuma

texts.en: Mwanajuma is married and has five children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped-in water, and her greatest monthly expense is food for her family. For the past two years, she has earned a living selling vegetables from her home. Her main challenge is competition from other local vendors, but she is committed to expand her business and meet the needs of more customers. She is applying for a loan for Kshs. 30,000 to buy bundles of onions, green vegetables, cabbages and bananas. She decided to join Yehu to get access to loans which will allow her to boost her business.

loans.use: to buy bundles of onions, green vegetables, cabbages and bananas.

loans.name: Halima

texts.en: Halima is married and has four children, three of whom attend school while her youngest child is not yet old enough to go. She owns a house that has piped-in water but not electricity and her greatest monthly expense is food for her family. For the past six months, she has made a living selling water to neighbors and passersby. Her biggest challenge is competition from other water vendors in the area, but she dreams of expanding her business in the future. She has applied for a loan for Kshs. 20,000 to buy bundles of wheat flour, cooking fat oil and sugar. She decided to join Yehu to gain access to loans that would help her boost her business.

loans.use: to buy bundles of wheat flour, cooking fat, oil and sugar.

loans.name: Mwanakombo

texts.en: Mwanakombo is married and has four children, three of whom attend school while her fourth is too young to go. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped-in water, and her greatest monthly expense is food for her family. For the past three years, she has made a living selling food to her neighbors. Her main challenge is competition from other food vendors, but she is determined to expand her business. She is applying for a loan for Kshs. 30,000 to buy bundles of wheat flour, beans and cooking oil. She decided to join Yehu to secure access to the loans she needs to boost her business.

loans.use: to buy bundles of wheat flour, beans and cooking oil.

loans.name: Loida

texts.en:
Loida is a single 41 year-old woman living with her mother.  She is the breadwinner of the family of farmers in the Philippines.
Loida runs a sari-sari store business.  She sells snack foods, drinks, medicines and soap. She has been in this business for over 10 years. Loida's estimated income monthly is P10,000. She wants to earn a higher income monthly to continue to sustain their needs.

Loida is asking for a loan of P27,000 to buy additional goods to sell, like breads, coffee, sugar and spices.  She is a God-fearing person and has a strong faith that someday she will successfully help her family out of poverty.

loans.use: to buy additional goods to sell, like breads, coffee, sugar and spices

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stock cellphone accessories, such as different casings of cellphones and different kinds of groceries for her retail shop business

loans.name: Foresty Group

texts.en:
Jentrix is the facilitator for the Foresty Group in Chwele.  This group is comprised of two men and five women.  The group began working with One Acre Fund in 2010 and has continued participating since that time.  They plan on once again enrolling for the 2012 season.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important farming inputs to distribute to Jentrix and her group during Kenya's next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund's integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance. 

Jentrix says that she joined One Acre Fund in order to grow enough food to feed her family and to have access to early input delivery. Jentrix has a large family with 12 children.  Jentrix reports that she has had a good harvest with One Acre Fund in 2011, achieving four bags on 1/2 acre.  Before One Acre Fund, Jentrix says that she was only able to harvest one bag on 1/2 acre.  

Jentrix has 12 children at home.  With profits from her harvest, she plans on paying for her children's school fees, saving for the future, buying livestock, perhaps investing in a business, and purchasing more land.  

In total, the Foresty Group expects to plant 11.25 acres of land in 2012, with each farmer planting between 1/2 and 1 1/2 acres.

loans.use: to source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season

loans.name: Jenalyn

texts.en:
Jenalyn is 24 years old and married. According to her, she did not finish her college education because her parents are financially unable to support her. She got married at the age of 18 and she has four children. With her husband's support, this serves as an inspiration for her to strive hard to provide sustenance for the family.

Jenalyn's source of income comes from raising crops. Her husband plows a one-hectare plot of land where she grows rice. She plants and harvests rice and sells it to traders at harvest. The couple needs to pay labor costs of an extra worker who helps with the activities of the farm. She is now asking for a loan of P10,000 to pay for labor costs in transplanting rice seedlings on her farm. 

In the future, Jenalyn wants to achieve a bountiful harvest and earn enough money to save for the education of her children. She wants them to have a brighter future someday.

loans.use: to pay for labor costs in transplanting rice seedlings on her farm

loans.name: Richel

texts.en:
Richel is happy living with her husband and two children. Richel’s husband is an electrician. She desires to maintain the good health and good relationship of her family.  She is managing a sari-sari store business. She sells noodles, eggs and bananas.  Richel is happy managing her business because she loves what she does.

Richel's goal is to gain higher income and smoothly develop her business for the benefit of her children’s education. She wants to borrow P15,000 to buy additional goods to sell in their village, like salt, coffee, shampoo, soap and toothpaste.

loans.use: to buy additional goods to sell in their village ,like salt, coffee, shampoo, soap and toothpaste.

loans.name: Abasangirakiyago Group

texts.fr:
Mathieu est un commerçant âgé de 53ans qui habite  la localité de Nyamugari au centre du pays dans la Province de Gitega. Il  fait le commerce de haricots depuis 13ans. Il fut Boulanger avant de commencer le metier actuel. Il a fréquenté l’école jusqu’en 6e année des études primaires. Il est marié a Philote et père de 4 enfants qui n’ont pas encore commence l’ecole. 
Le crédit Kiva  de 250,000 francs burundais qu’il obtient lui permet d’augmenter son capital en achetant une  plus grande quantite de haricots a revendre afin de  réaliser de grands bénéfices. 

Il est membre  du groupe  communautaire« ABASANGIRAKIYAGO».
texts.en:
Mathieu, age 53, is a merchant who lives in Nyamugari, Gitega Province, in the center of the country. He's been selling beans for 13 years. Before that, he was a baker. He attended elementary school up to the sixth year. He's married to Philote, and the father of four children. None of them attends school yet.

His part of the Kiva loan amounts to 250'000 BIF and will enable him to bolster his working capital and purchase a larger quantity of bean to resell, in order to turn a bigger profit. He's a member of the community group ABASANGIRAKIYAGO.

loans.use: to buy a large quantity of beans to resell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase three sacks of cashew nuts for resale.

loans.name: Dusabe Group

texts.fr:
Matronne  est une commerçante  âgée de 45 ans . Elle habite  la localité de Rutonde en province de Gitega.  Elle vend les produits alimentaires  (avocats) depuis 3 ans. Elle est aussi cultivatrice. Elle a fait les études jusqu’en 2e année primaire.Elle est divorcee  et mere de 4 enfants dont 2 sont a l’ecole.
 Le crédit de Kiva de 100000 Fbu va  lui permettre  d’augmenter  le capital  afin d’acheter  beaucoup  de  produits  alimentaires(avocats) dans le but de realiser de grands bénéfices. 
Elle est membre du groupe communautaire  “DUSABE”
texts.en:
Matronne, age 45, is a merchant. She lives in Rutonde, Gitega Province, and she's been selling food products (avocados) for three years. She's also a cultivator. She attended elementary school up to the second year. She's divorced and the mother of four children, out of whom two attend school. 

Her share of the Kiva loan amounts to 100'000 BIF, and will enable her to bolster her working capital and buy lots of avocados, in order to turn a healthy profit. She's a member of the community group DUSABE

loans.use: to buy and resell a large quantity of avocados

loans.name: Tubehoneza Group

texts.fr:
Godelieve  est une commerçante  âgée de 30 ans . Elle habite  la localité de Bukirasazi en province de Gitega.  Elle vend les produits alimentaires  (bananes et haricots) depuis 12 ans. Elle est aussi cultivatrice. Elle a fait les études jusqu’en 6e année primaire.Elle est mariee et mere de 5 enfants dont 3étudient.
 Le crédit de Kiva de 140000 Fbu va  lui permettre  d’augmenter  le capital  afin d’acheter beaucoup  de  produits  alimentaires(bananes et haricots) dans le but de realiser de grands bénéfices. 
Elle est membre du groupe communautaire  “TUBEHONEZA”
texts.en:
Godelieve, age 30, is a merchant who lives in Bukirasazi, Gitega Province. She's been selling food products (bananas and beans) for 12 years. She's also a cultivator. She attended elementary school up to the sixth year. She's married and the mother of five children, out of whom three attend school.

Her share of the Kiva loan amounts to 140000 BIF, and will enable her to increase her working capital and buy large quantities of bananas and beans, in order to turn a healthy profit. She's a member of the community group TUBEHONEZA.

loans.use: to buy and resell large quantities of bananas and beans

loans.name: Nimfa

texts.en: Nimfa is 45 years old and lives in Antonino, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte. She is married, has six children and has earned a living for the last 20 years by selling fish. She is applying for a loan for PHP 4,000 to buy a box of fish to sell to her customers. She joined PMPC earlier this year and hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase bundles of fish for resale.

loans.name: Bintiali

texts.en:
Bintiali is a married woman with two children, both of whom attend school. She lives at a rental house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past three years, she has operated a fish business, selling at the market to her neighbors and market dwellers. She faces a major challenge of competition from other fish operators in the market. She dreams of establishing a fish selling shop in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000, she wants to purchase bundles of fish and cooking oil. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of fish and cooking oil.

loans.name: Ailyn

texts.en:
Ailyn is the only child of her parents. Ailyn is 25 years of age and is single. She finished her study and holds a Bachelor of Education degree.  Ailyn is happy living with her father.  Her mother was engaged in the retail business but died two years ago from illness. Ailyn needs to continue her mother's business in order to pay for the expenses of the hospital during her mother's illness.  Deep inside, she is sad because of the loss her mother. Ailyn is learning to stand without her mother. 

Ailyn manages the sari-sari store well. She sells snack foods, cooking oil and drinks. She is looking for a loan of P18,000 to buy beer, spices, breads, noodles and diapers for her customers in their village.  Ailyn's dream is to succeed in the business she has now, while still seeking a job that is suited to her degree.

loans.use: to buy beer, spices, breads, noodles and diapers

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma is 54 years old, widowed, and lives in the village of Turod Norte Cordon. She is thankful because she only has one child, currently studying. She is engaged in buying and selling pigs and direct selling, particularly Personal Collection, Avon and MSE. She has had this kind of business for one year and she is able to earn P4,000 a month. 

Norma is spending her income on her student and the payment of electric bills. That's why she is in need of additional capital amounting to P10,000 which will be used to purchase pigs and cosmetic products for her business improvement. 

With this loan amount, she will be able to increase her sales in  both businesses. She really hopes that she can obtain this loan amount in order to support her student and continue to sustain their daily needs.

loans.use: to buy pigs to be sold in their village and in a market stall.

loans.name: Lennie

texts.en:
Lennie is married with three children. She is 36 years old and lives in Dumanhog, Siquijor Province. She sells Ready-to-Wear clothes to earn a living and had this business for one year.  Each month, she earns P 1,000 net income doing this type of work.  She has requested a loan of P 7,000 as working capital in the said business.

Lennie has been a member of Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative for 2 months.  In the future, Lennie hopes to generate more income out from her business and be more productive.

loans.use: To purchase new clothing supplies to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Simiren

texts.en:
Simiren is 42 years old and married with four children. He has been doing farming on his land for the last fifteen years.

He was introduced to KADET LTD by the KADET staff in his area of abode. This is his fourth loan which he has planned to spend purchase farm inputs and for the preparation of the land. He intends to use the return from the loan to reinvest in farming and part to repay the loan.

His imagining is to become a famous farmer in the area and to educate his kids to higher levels of education. He an assiduous man despite his older age who struggles to achieve when funded.

loans.use: purchase farm inputs and for the preparation of the land.

loans.name: Leposo

texts.en:
Leposo has been a farmer for the last ten years. He is 43 years old  married and blessed with three children. He learned about KADET LTD from the marketing done by the KADET staff in his area of abode. 

Being this is his third loan, he plans to spend it to purchase farm supplies. He intends to use the returns from the loan to re-invest in farming and buy a bigger farm.


His dream is to be the best and a well-known farmer in the area. He is an industrious man who can do well if funded.

loans.use: to purchase farm supplies.

loans.name: Nyuga

texts.en:
Nyuga is a married woman who owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past two years, she has operated a food stall business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She dreams of expanding her business and establishing a restaurant in the future. 

With the Kshs 15,000 she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, sugar and cooking fat. She decided to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of wheat flour, sugar and cooking fat.

loans.name: Konana

texts.en:
Konana has been operating a "boda boda" motorbike for the past three years. He is married with two children.

He was introduced to KADET LTD by a registered client. He applied for his first loan to expand his "boda boda" business. 

He hopes to make a profit and dreams that in the near future he will buy a vehicle which can do better than a motorbike. He is a hardworking man who can do more if funded.

loans.use: to expand his "boda boda" (motorcycle transport) business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more stock like cooking fat, soft drinks, sugar, salt, etc.

loans.name: Forest B Group

texts.en:
Justine is the facilitator for Forest Group B.  Justine and her group members joined One Acre Fund in 2011.  Justine says that she joined One Acre Fund in order to grow enough food to feed her family and to access fertilizer and hybrid seed.  Justine has two children at home along with her husband.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important farming inputs to distribute to Justine and her group during Kenya's next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund's integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance. 

In the most recent maize harvest season, Justine reports that her farm yielded 10 bags of maize on 1/2 acre, a large improvement from 2 bags per 1/2 acre that she says she harvested before joining One Acre Fund.  

With the profits from this year's harvest, Justine plans on buying livestock such as poultry and goats, saving money to pay off her next loan, and perhaps join a community savings group.

Forest Group B will plant a total of 3.75 acres of maize in 2012, with each farmer planting between 1/2 and 3/4 acres.

Above, Justine and other group members are pictured holding cobs from their most recent maize harvest!

loans.use: to source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season

loans.name: Oloishuru

texts.en:
Oloishuru is 31 and married with one child. His monthly income is KES 8,000. He has been a farmer for the past five years. 

He was introduced to KADET by a registered client.This is his third loan, and he plans  to buy farm supplies like seeds and fertilizer  and also pay labor for land preparation. He intends to reinvest the anticipated profit from the loan in other business and pay school fees for his child..

loans.use: buy farm supplies like seeds and fertilizer  and also pay labor for land preparation.

loans.name: Awlata

texts.fr:
Awlata est une femme âgée de 35 ans. Elle est mariée å un couturier. Elle a 02 enfants tous scolarisés. 
Awlata travaille comme restauratrice (vendeuse de « COMM » une nourriture faite à base de maïs que la population togolaise apprécie) depuis 2000. Elle est aidée par 01 personne et vend en face d’un bar.
Awlata a requis son quatrième  cycle de prêt à WAGES afin d’acheter du maïs et du poisson. Elle veut ouvrir un autre coin de vente. 
Dans les prochaines années, Awlata voudrait voir évoluer son activité. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, Elle  veut voir sa famille s’épanouir.
texts.en:
Awlata, age 35, is married to a dressmaker. She has two children, who both attend school. She's been working in the food serving business since 2000, selling "COMM" (a corn-based dish enjoyed by the Togolese population). She's helped by one employee, and has her booth opposite a bar.

Awlata is seeking her fourth loan from Kiva's partner, WAGES, in order to buy corn and fish. She wants to open another sales point. In the forthcoming years, she would like to see her business progress. She says that she will use her profits to help her family blossom.

loans.use: to buy corn and freshwater fish

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is 37 years old and married with one child.

Gloria works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. 

Gloria has borrowed and repaid three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for six years and also earns an income from food vending.

Gloria aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional items to sell.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Sahadatou

texts.fr:
Sahadatou est une femme âgée de 34 ans. Elle est mariée å un mécanicien chauffeur. Elle a 01 enfant âgé de 03ans non scolarisé.
Sahadatou travaille comme revendeuse de pagnes depuis 2009. Elle a un étalage sur lequel elle expose ses marchandises.
Sahadatou a requis son premier cycle de prêt à WAGES afin d’acheter des pagnes. Elle veut augmenter le stock. 
Dans les prochaines années, Sahadatou voudrait avoir une boutique. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, Elle veut assurer la scolarisation de ses enfants et faire évoluer son activité.
texts.en:
Sahadatou is 34 years old and married to a mechanic. She has a 3 year old child who does not yet attend school.
Sahadatou has worked as a retailer of loincloths since 2009. She has a stall where she displays her merchandise.
Sahadatou has requested her first loan at WAGES in order to buy loincloths. She would like to increase her stock.
In the next few years, Sahadatou would like to open a shop. She says that with the profits, she will assure the education of her children and further develop her business.

loans.use: to buy loincloths

loans.name: Nambasamba A Group

texts.en:
Robert is the facilitator for Nambasana A Group.  This group joined One Acre Fund in 2010. Robert says that he joined One Acre Fund in order to access the best prices, grow enough food to feed his family, access fertilizer and hybrid seed. 

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important farming inputs to distribute to Robert and his group during Kenya's next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund's integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance. 

In his most recent harvest, Robert reports that he was able to get 9 bags of maize on 1/2 acre.  By his measure, this was an excellent harvest.  Before joining One Acre Fund, Robert was only able to get 4 bags on 1/2 acre of land.  

With the profits from his harvest, Robert plans on sending his children to school, repairing his home, saving for the future, investing in livestock, and perhaps investing in a business.  

In total, Robert's group will plant 6 acres of land in 2012, each farmer planting between 1/2 and 1 acre.

Robert's  Field Officer Josephine is in front of this picture.

loans.use: to source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season

loans.name: Lorena

texts.en:
Lorena is 39 years old and married with five children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy items like soft drinks and groceries to sell in her general store.

Lorena has borrowed and repaid 18 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 3 years and also earns income from fishing.

Lorena aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items like soft drinks and groceries to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Melkisedek

texts.en:
Melkisedek is 37 years old, married to Maria, 29. They are living in a modest house with two children, who are: Fernandus, 8, in the third grade of elementary school and Angela, 1 year old. 

Melkisedek used to work as a public minivan driver. Since the income earned from that job was insufficient for his family needs, he then decided to resign and initiated a kiosk business. 

He plans to complete the stock in his kiosk by adding rice, kerosene, milk, sugar, coffee, snacks, mineral water, etc. Melkisedek is seeking a loan of IDR 5,000,000 from TLM. Through this loan Melkisedek hopes that he can improve his business. He is expecting that TLM will provide a loan for his business improvement.

loans.use: To purchase more stock such as rice, kerosene, milk, sugar, coffee, snacks, mineral water, etc.

loans.name: Mirasol

texts.en:
Mirasol works hard to support her family. Mirasol is married and sells dried fish  in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 50,000 loan through NWTF to buy more dried fish to sell in her food stall.

Mirasol has been in this business for 20 years. In the future, Mirasol would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more dried fish to sell in her food stall.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is 66 years old and married with 10 children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock for her sari-sari store.

Erlinda has borrowed and repaid 15 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for 15 years and also earns an income from selling Ready-to-Wear.

Erlinda aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock for her sari-sari (variety) store.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
As a married parent of seven children, Eva works hard to support her family. She has a food vending business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from electronic re-loading and her general store. Eva is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food vending business.

Eva has been sustaining her business activities through her past eight loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to save money to expand her businesses.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for her food production business.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline is 40 years old, married, and has three school-aged children.She has been engaged in a general store business for one year.

One of her problems has been that several of her customers have had to go to other stores to buy their groceries because she did not have the products they wanted. In this regard, she is requesting a loan amount of P10,000 to invest in the grocery store she has. Her request will greatly benefit her, since she will be using the money to stock her store with products not found in her area. She is hoping that she will be able to send her children to college through the income she generates from her business.

loans.use: to buy groceries such as sugar, canned goods, shampoo, soft drinks, etc. for retail shop business.

loans.name: Sixto

texts.en:
Sixto is 42 years old, married and blessed with five children. He is a farmer who plants and harvests rice to sell. Sixto usually earns approximately 30,000 PHP for each harvest season in one hectare. It will be special for him if he gains a higher income than usual from his farm because he will use it for his children's education.
Sixto plans to change his farming strategy to gain a higher income. He wants to apply the exact amount of farm inputs required on his farm, but his capital is insufficient to buy the needed inputs. For this reason, Sixto is asking for a loan of 25,000 PHP to buy farm inputs such as fertilizers, herbicides and insecticides for rice farming. Sixto always wants to be successful in every decision he makes and combine his decisions with action.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs such as fertilizers, herbicides and insecticides for rice farming.

loans.name: Mehesinawe

texts.fr:
Mehesinawe est une femme  âgée de 39 ans. Elle est mariée å un policier. Elle a 02 enfants tous deux vont à l’ecole. Le premier a 20 ans et le dernier a 12ans.
Mehesinawe travaille comme revendeuse de friperies(les habits importés de l’Europe) depuis 2005. Il vend à la maison.
Mehesinawe a requis son premier cycle de prêt à WAGES afin d’acheter de la marchandise. Il veut réinvestir dans son activité. 
Dans les prochaines années, Mehesinawe voudrait agrandir son activité. Il dit qu’avec les profits, Il veut acheter une moto pour son fils.
texts.en:
Mehesinawe, 39, is married to a policeman. She has two children and both go to school. The older is 20 and the younger is 12. 

Mehesinawe has been working selling used clothing (clothing imported from Europe)  since 2005. She sells out of her home. 

Mehesinawe has requested her first loan from WAGES in order to buy more merchandise. She wants to reinvest in her business.  

In the next few years,  Mehesinawe would like to expand her business. She says that with the profit she wants to buy a motorcycle for her son.

loans.use: to buy used clothing for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more clothes for resale.

loans.name: Nikodemus

texts.en:
Nikodemus is a 49-year-old man who is married to Magdalena, 50. They are blessed with six children: Petronela, 22, Benediktus, 21, Financia, 20, Laurensius, 18, Irene, 17 and Claudius, 12, who is studying in the sixth grade of elementary school.
Nikodemus is the breadwinner for his family. He raises pigs and cattle to be sold in the market. Nikodemus has been involved in this business for years. He also has a plot of land to cultivate vegetables and cassava. After harvest, he sells them at the market in his village.
Generating income from selling fattened livestock takes time. Therefore Nikodemus plans to improve his farming business. He is requesting a loan of 7,500,000 IDR from Kiva partner, TLM. He would like to buy seeds, fertilizer and fodder such corn and dedak (a mixture of rice and bran). He hopes that his application will be approved by TLM soon.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizer and fodder such corn and dedak (a mixture of rice and bran).

loans.name: Mifutu Group

texts.en:
Dennis is the facilitator for Mifutu Group.  Most farmers in Mifuti group just completed their first season with One Acre Fund.  

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important farming inputs to distribute to Dennis and his group during Kenya's next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund's integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance. 

Dennis says that he joined One Acre Fund in order to harvest more maize from his land than in previous years, grow enough to feed his family, access good input prices, to have profits to send his children to school, and to learn good quality farming techniques.  

Dennis has not yet harvested the maize that he grew this season, but before joining One Acre Fund, he was only able to harvest 4 bags per 1/2 acre.  He is likely to double that when he harvests this month!

With profits from his harvest, Dennis plans to send his children to school, repair his home, save for the future, and invest in livestock.  

In the coming 2012 season, Mifutu Group will plant 8.5 acres of land, with each farmer planting between 1/2 and 1 acre each.

In the picture above, the group is standing in front of a maize field planted with One Acre Fund.  The group Field Officer is second from the left.

loans.use: to source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is a 45-year-old lady who is married to Mikael, a 52-year-old laborer. They have three children: Dominggus, 22, Flavianus, 19 and Gresensiana, 12, who is studying in the sixth grade of elementary school. 
In order to support her husband in meeting their family’s needs, Maria runs a kiosk business. This business has been operating for years. Her husband supported her with capital to set up the business by purchasing stock such as noodles, sugar, coffee, various snacks, cigarettes, detergent, soap, etc. She likes to run this business to support her husband in generating more income for her family.
Maria is wanting to add more stock of basic household items in her kiosk such as rice, vegetables, cooking oil, betel nuts, betel vine, etc. She needs more capital to do so. Therefore, she is requesting a loan of 10,000,000 IDR from Kiva partner, TLM. She hopes TLM is willing to assist her in improving her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock such as rice, vegetables, cooking oil, betel nuts, betel vine, etc.

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma is 52 years old and married with six children. She works hard to provide for her family. Gemma buys and sells rice in the Philippines and has requested a loan of 22,000 PHP through Kiva partner, NWTF, to buy additional stock to sell.
Gemma has borrowed and paid back 24 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running her business for 13 years and also earns an income from a sari-sari store and farming. Gemma aspires to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional stock to sell.

loans.name: Poulyne

texts.en:
Poulyne is 34 years old, married to Peterson, and blessed with one child aged 10. She has been in the cosmetics business for the last two years, making a monthly profit of 10,000 KES. She has been loaned 80,000 KES, which she plans to use to stock beauty products, creams, lotions, etc.
With the anticipated profits, she plans to expand her business and educate her child to higher levels of education. In the near future, she hopes to venture into the business of supplying electricity poles to the Kenya Power and Lighting Company.

loans.use: to purchase stock such as beauty products, creams, lotions, etc.

loans.name: Tarcila

texts.en:
Tarcila is 61 years old and married with seven children. She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Tarcila is borrowing 15,000 PHP through Kiva partner, NWTF, to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.
Tarcila has been farming rice for 20 years and also earns additional income from fishing and buying and selling charcoal. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Tsungirirayi Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Zimbabwe! This is 50-year-old Itayi from Masvingo. She is widowed and has six children, age 16 to 32. The youngest is attending school.  

Itayi has a poultry business. The business has been in operation for 10 years. She says the main challenges she faces are financial constraints. Itayi has requested a loan of $400 to buy chicks. She says the extra income generated will go toward the upkeep of her family. 

In the future, Itayi plans to open a supermarket.

loans.use: To buy some chicks.

loans.name: Roukeyatou

texts.fr:
Roukeyatou est une femme âgée de 31 ans. Elle est mariée à un commerçant. Elle a 2 enfants.  
Roukeyatou travaille comme revendeuse depuis 2002. Elle vend des produits géneriques à toutes les personnes au marché. Elle travaille seule. 
Roukeyatou a requis son premier crédit à WAGES afin d’acheter des produits génériques. Elle veut étendre son activité.
Dans les prochaines années, Roukeyatou voudrait agrandir son marché. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, Elle prévoit avoir une famille heureuse.
texts.en:
Roukeyatou, 31, is married to a retailer and has two children. She has been working selling generic products since 2002. She sells the generic products to all comers in the marketplace. She works alone. 

Roukeyatou has requested her first loan from WAGES in order to buy generic products. She wants to expand her business. 

In the coming years, she would like to reach more customers. She says that with the profit she intends to have a happy family.

loans.use: to buy generic products for resale.

loans.name: Semly

texts.en:
Semly, 33, is married to Denci, 28. They are blessed with two children: Dony, 8, who is studying in the second grade of elementary school, and Natasya, 5, who is at kindergarten.
Semly is a fishmonger and this business has been supporting him in generating income for his family since 1997. With a small amount of capital, he set up this business by selling fish from door to door. After several years he decided to operate the business in the market. 
Currently, Semly is planning to purchase more fish such as belang kuning fish (yellow mottled fish) since most of his customers prefer such fish. Therefore, Semly is seeking a loan of 5,000,000 IDR from Kiva partner, TLM, to buy fish in large quantities. Semly is hoping TLM will approve his loan application soon.

loans.use: to purchase more fish such as belang kuning fish (yellow mottled fish).

loans.name: Ainagul's Group

texts.en:
Ainagul is the leader of this group. She is 46 and together with her husband, who works in Russia, she has raised two daughters and three sons. The daughters are married, the youngest son studies and the other two sons are working in Russia with their father. In order to earn additional money for the family budget, Ainagul breeds livestock and cultivates agricultural products. By reselling livestock after fattening and selling part of the harvest, Ainagul contributes about 5,000 KGS to the family budget. She has applied for this loan because she needs money to purchase fuel and hire labor in order to collect the harvest (she grew a hectare of sunflowers). In the future she plans to celebrate her son’s wedding and build a house for him. Where did this loan come from?
This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line: People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and society as well), Planet (being environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135.
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team – Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – at www.kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase fuel and hire labor for collecting the harvest.

loans.name: Zizhou Group

texts.en:
This is 57-year-old Abigail from Masvingo in Zimbabwe. She is married and has five children age 41, 39, 31, 29 and 16. One is attending school. 

Abigail sells clothes and plates. The business has been in operation for six years. She says the main challenge she faces is lack of capital to buy more goods to sell. Abigail has requested a loan of $400 to increase her stocks. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her to increase disposable income and improve the family's quality of life. 

In the future Abigail plans to have her own shop in town.

loans.use: To buy clothes, plates and maize for sale.

loans.name: Kibibi

texts.en:
Kibibi is a married woman with two children, both of whom attend school. She lives in a rental house that has real estate and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.
For the past three years, she has operated a stationery business, selling retail to her neighbors and passers-by. She faces a major challenge of seasonality and high transport costs in her business. She dreams of expanding her business in the future.
With this loan of 80,000 KES, she wants to purchase stationery, printing paper and pens, and repair her photocopier machine. She decided to join Kiva partner, Yehu, to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stationery, printing paper and pens, and repair her photocopier machine.

loans.name: Wema Group

texts.en:
Kennedy is the facilitator for Wema Group.  He and his co-members joined One Acre Fund in 2011. Kennedy joined the program in order to access quality inputs, to be able to receive inputs close to his own village, and to increase his harvests.  

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important farming inputs to distribute to Kennedy and his group during Kenya's next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund's integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance. 

Kennedy has not yet harvested his 2011 crop, but expects 8-10 bags on his 1/2 acre. 

With proceeds from his harvest, Kennedy will invest in his children's education, repair his home, save for the future, and invest in livestock.  

In 2012, Wema group will plant a total of 3.5 acres of land, with each farmer planting between 1/2 and 1 acres.

loans.use: to source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season

loans.name: Djouweratou

texts.fr:
Djouweratou est une femme âgée de 28 ans. Elle est mariée à un tailleur-brodeur. Elle a 1 enfant. 
Djouweratou travaille comme revendeuse depuis 1999. Elle vend des produits céréaliers et ignames à toutes les personnes à la maison. Elle achète les produits au grand marché. Elle travaille seule.
Djouweratou a requis son premier crédit à WAGES afin d’acheter des produits céréaliers et des ignames.
Dans les prochaines années, Djouweratou voudrait étendre son activité. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, elle prévoit avoir une famille heureuse.
texts.en:
Djouweratou, 28, is married to a tailor/embroiderer and has one child. 

Djouweratou has been selling goods since 1999. She sells cereals and cocoyams to all comers at her home. She buys the products in the central market. She works alone. 

Djouweratou has requested her first loan from WAGES in order to buy cereals and cocoyams. In the coming years, she would like to expand her business. She says that with her profit she intends to have a happy family.

loans.use: to buy cereals and cocoyams for resale.

loans.name: Edimar

texts.en:
Edimar is 29 years old and has been a tricycle operator for almost three years. He is married and blessed with two children. His wife is currently working abroad as an OFW (overseas foreign worker), particularly in Singapore, just to improve their living conditions. Aside from the transportation business, he also works in the field every harvesting season for further improvement of their living standards. He does not just rely on the remittances from his wife.

He is requesting P5,000 to buy paints and steel parts, and for maintenance of his motor. He insists on providing good service to gain more customers for higher profits that will allow him to save for his children. He hopes to finish his children's education through his hard work and perseverance.

loans.use: to buy paints and steel parts, and to maintain his motor

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha is 44 years old. She is a female operator of a tricycle transportation service. As a female driver, it is a little bit difficult, but she still goes on to thrive and pursue her occupation. She is working hard to provide the needs of her family.
