Aside from her transportation business, she is engaged in selling different kinds of fish in their community as a secondary source of income.

She is requesting a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy new tires and to buy fish for her businesses. She hopes to expand her business to be able to provide the needs of her family, especially the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy new tires

loans.name: Yanti

texts.en:
Yanti is a 27-year-old single lady. She lives with her parents and siblings at her parent’s house. Her parents are working as farmers. In order to support her family life, Yanti runs a kiosk business using capital from her sister. She just initiated the business three months ago.  

Yanti sells primary commodities such as petrol, kerosene, detergent, shampoo, a variety of snacks, rice, etc at her kiosk. Currently, she dreams of improving her business by adding more stock such as sacks of rice, various snacks, instant noodles and cigarettes as demanded by her customers. 

In order to make her dreams come true, she is requesting a loan from TLM amounting to IDR 5,000,000. She is hoping that TLM is willing to assist her.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks such as sacks of rice, various snacks, instant noodle and cigarettes

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.en:
Mercedes is 53 years old. She has a mini restaurant in the market place. She has been administering her business for 20 years and earns an average of 5,000 every month. The existing competitors are the undermining of her income per month. Thus, she goes over the flow and competes to earn a higher income.

She is asking for a loan of PHP 7,000 as additional working capital to buy vegetables and meat to cook. She wants to offer a variety of foods and viands in order to attract more customers. Through this, Mercedes can earn greater net sales per month that can be used for the education of her youngest child who is still pursuing an education.

She hopes for further development of her business and their living conditions to experience a comfortable life.

loans.use: to buy  vegetables and meat to cook

loans.name: Remalyn

texts.en:
Remalyn is 27 years old. She has a dry goods stand in their market. She sells dresses, shorts and pants. For the three months she has been operating her business, she is earning PHP 25,000. Just enough to sustain the school fees of her two children, allowances, electric bills and food for a month.

She wants to increase her capacity for sales. Therefore, she needs a loan of  PHP 10,000 to buy new dry goods such as pants, shirts and skirts as additional goods to sell in her stand. She hopes this loan will contribute success to her business in order to develop their living conditions.

loans.use: to buy new dry goods such as pants, shirts and skirts

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
“Every painstaking, there is satisfaction and prosperity.” This quotation was stated by Joyce. She is a business-minded woman who is engaged in selling vegetables. She has been working so hard to provide the educational needs of her two children. She doesn’t want her children to have the same fate as her. 

She’s already been operating her business for seven years. During this time, she usually earns a net income of PHP 10,000 that she saves for emergency purposes. Despite the difficulty of selling, she works hard to provide the needs of her family.

She is requesting a loan of PHP 15,000 as additional working capital to buy beans, cabbage, squash and onions. She hopes that she could roll her loan amount to improve their living conditions as well as to prosper her business.

loans.use: to buy beans, cabbage, squash and onions

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
“I learned that the only way you are going to get anywhere in life is to work hard at it. Whether you're a musician, a writer or a businessman, there is no getting around it. If you do, you'll win-if you don't you won't” simply stresses Mercy. Mercy is a 47-year-old hard-working businesswoman who sells dry goods in their community.

She offers dresses, shorts, pants and underwear, which she has been doing for eight years now. She is earning a net income of PHP 50,000 every month, which she uses for the education of her six children. Part of it, she invests in the bank for safety. She wants to put in additional goods to sell. For that reason, she wants a loan of PHP 20,000 to buy pants and shorts. A part of it will be used to improve her current business.

Hopefully, she will be succeeding in every opportunity that God has given to her to help others through offering jobs (hiring a saleslady) to people in their community.

loans.use: to buy pants and shorts

loans.name: Mberi Group

texts.en:
Jonas is 65 years old and lives in Masvingo. He is married and has five children aged 26, 31 and 33. None of his children attends school. 

Jonas sells clothes and drinks. He has been doing this business for eight years. He says the main challenge he faces is lack of sufficient working capital. Jonas has requested a loan of $400 to buy clothing and drinks for sale. He will use says the extra income generated to expand his business and pay his bills. 

In the future, Jonas plans to build a big business that will employ more people.

loans.use: To buy clothing and drinks for sale.

loans.name: James

texts.en: James is a business man aged 23 years old, and he is single. For the last seven years he has been selling sausages to earn a living. In the next five years, he wants to become a major distributor of sausages in his region. He is requesting a loan of 10,000 Kenya shillings (KES) to buy a trolley for distributing sausages.

loans.use: To buy a trolley for distributing sausage.

loans.name: Ricardo

texts.en:
“Keep your dreams alive. Understand to achieve anything requires faith and belief in yourself, vision, hard work, determination, and dedication. Remember all things are possible for those who believe,” is an expression of Ricardo, a 46-year-old businessman. He is an owner of a variety store operating successfully for 12 years and earning a PHP 10,000 every month.

An optimistic person like Ricardo provides further positive results in every inch of his work. He keeps on dreaming and wishes to achieve his dream through a loan of PHP 10,000 as additional working capital. This will be used to buy supplementary stock such as soft drinks for his variety store. He hopes this would be a big contribution to achieve success.

He hopes for every success in his operation to help more people.

loans.use: to buy supplementary stock such as soft drinks in his variety store

loans.name: And Liguéye Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité AND liguéye a été créé le 16/06/2009.Il est composé de 10 femmes issues du même village.Leurs activités sont:l'agriculture et l'élevage. 

Madame Ndéye en position debout et à l'extreme droite sur la photo,est responsable du groupement.
Elle est âgée de 39 ans,est mariée et mére de 05 enfants.

Son activité consiste à faire de l'élevage de moutons.Elle dispose d'une bonne expérience pour ce type d'activité.

Son pret lui permettra d'acheter des moutons.

Son objectif est de pouvoir faire l'élevage de bœufs et la production d'huile,afin de participer aux charges familiales et d'assurer une bonne scolarité à ses enfants.
texts.en:
The And Liguéye solidarity group was formed on June 16, 2009.  It’s made up of 10 women from the same village.  Their business is agriculture and livestock raising.

Ndéye, who is standing at far right in the picture, is the group leader. She is 39 years old, married and a mother of five children.

Her business is raising sheep.  She has a good deal of experience in this business.

Her loan will enable her to purchase more sheep.

Her goal is to be able to raise cattle and produce oil, so as to help cover the family’s expenses and ensure that her children can attend school.

loans.use: to purchase sheep

loans.name: Florante

texts.en:
“Being smart is used in the development of own self, people around you and not to use for self-interest.”  This quotation is stated by Florante. He is a business-minded man who operates his own furniture and upholstery shop. In his statement, he has proven that he used his skills and abilities to develop his business and provide employment to their community, especially to the married man.

He’s already been administering his business for 28 years. For these years, he usually earns a net income of PHP 40,000 that he saves for his future family. Despite being single at the age of 45, he works hard as if a married man to provide the needs of his parents as well as his own needs.

He is requesting a loan of PHP 25,000 as additional working capital. This will be use to buy wood, lumber and varnish as added materials in his shop. He hopes that he can carefully roll his loan amount to improve their lifestyle as well as his business.

loans.use: to buy wood, lumber and varnish

loans.name: Mbolea Group

texts.en:
Gideon is the facilitator for Mbolea Group.  He and his group members joined One Acre Fund in 2010. Gideon joined One Acre Fund in order to access good input prices, grow enough to feed his family, have profits for school fees, and have inputs delivered right to his village market. 

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important farming inputs to distribute to Gideon and his group during Kenya's next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund's integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance. 

In 2011, Gideon harvested 8 bags of maize on 1/2 acre of land.  He describes his harvest as excellent.  Prior to joining One Acre Fund, Gideon was harvesting 6 bags on 1/2 an acre.  

With the profits from his harvest, Gideon plans on paying school fees, repairing his home, saving for the future, investing in livestock and perhaps investing in a business.  

In 2012, Mbolea group will receive input loans for 9.5 acres of land.  Each farmer will plant between 1/2 and 1 1/2 acres.

loans.use: to source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season

loans.name: Germilyn

texts.en:
An industrious woman, Germilyn is a mother of two children. She said, “I've always worked very, very hard, and the harder I worked, the luckier I got”. Through her hard work, she finished sending her children to high school and has the confidence to send them to college.  She engaged in business to earn money for the education of her children.

She is a sari-sari (variety) store owner. She sells toothpaste, powdered soap and juice. Her profit is PHP 3,000 every month that she usually uses to buy their daily needs such as food. She would like to strengthen her business. Therefore, she is asking for a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy cooking oil, candies and bread as additional goods to sell in her store. This would increase her net sales every month to save for future use.

loans.use: to buy cooking oil, candies and bread to sell in her store

loans.name: Deggo 2 Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité deggo2 a été créé le 16/06/2009.IL est composé de 20 femmes issues du même village.Leurs activités principales sont l'agriculture et l'élevage.

Madame Aminata en position debout sur la photo et à l'extreme droite,est responsable du groupe.
Elle est âgée de 42 ans,elle est mariée et mére de 04 enfants.
Son activité consiste à l'élevage des moutons.

Elle dispose d'une bonne activité pour ce type d'activité.

Son pret lui permettra d'acheter des moutons afin d'agrandir son cheptel.

Son objectif est d'acheter des bœufs et participer aux charges familiales.
texts.en:
The Deggo 2 solidarity group was formed on June 16, 2009.  It is made up of 20 women from the same village.  Their main businesses are agriculture and livestock raising.

Aminata, who is standing at far right in the picture, is the group leader.  She is 42 years old, married and a mother of four children.  Her business is raising sheep.  She has a good deal of experience doing business in this sector.

Her loan will enable her purchase more sheep to add to her holdings.

Her goal is to purchase cattle and help contribute to covering the family’s expenses.

loans.use: to purchase sheep

loans.name: Josphine

texts.en: Josphine is a businesswoman aged 38; she is married and blessed with four children. For the last three years, she has been managing a retail shop to make a living. She also does horticultural farming for more income. In the next five years, she wants to manage a wholesale business. She is requesting a loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings to buy sugar, salt and rice. Thanks to Faulu Kenya, she has been able to save the income she earns from her business.

loans.use: To buy rice, sugar and salt.

loans.name: Baye Niass Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité BAYE a été créé le 16/06/2009.Il est composé de 16 femmes issues du même village.Leurs activités sont: le commerce,l'agriculture et l'élevage.

Madame Amine, en position debout et à l'extreme droite sur la photo, est responsable du groupement,elle est âgée de 26 ans,elle est mariée et mére de 02 enfants.
Son activité est le commerce des légumes.

Elle dispose d'une bonne expérience pour ce type d'activité pour l'avoir exercé depuis longtemps.

Son pret lui permettra d'acheter des légumes destinés à la vente.

Son objectif est d'ouvrir une boutique afin de s'occuper de sa famille.
texts.en:
The Baye Niass solidarity group was created on June 16, 2009. It consists of 16 women from the same village who conduct trade, farming and cattle rearing.

Mrs Amine, standing on the far right-hand side of the photo, chairs the group. She is 26 years old, married and the mother of two children. She sells vegetables. After many years in this activity she has a lot of experience. She will use her loan to buy vegetables for resale. Her objective is to open a store in order to take care of her family.

loans.use: to buy vegetables.

loans.name: Domitila

texts.en:
Domitila is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She lives at a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

For the past ten years, she has operated a grocery business, selling retail to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of transportation and seasonality in her business. She dreams of expanding her business in the future.

With the Kshs 80,000 she wants to purchase bundles of vegetables, potatoes, tomatoes and sacks of charcoal. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of vegetables, potatoes, tomatoes and sacks of charcoal.

loans.name: Avelino

texts.en:
Avelino is 51 years old and engaged in a hog-fattening business as a primary source of income. He was blessed with five children. He works hard to provide for their needs especially for their education so they avoid what he is experiencing now. He suffers a lot just to scrape by and earn enough income for his family.

He has a net income of P3,000 after selling each raised pig, a very minimal sum to provide for their needs. In the desire to increase his sales he is asking for a loan amount of P5,000 to buy feed and vitamins for his current hogs and two more hogs as additional sources of sales. He hopes that his perseverance and this loan amount will be a big factor in lifting his family out of poverty.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for his current hogs and two more hogs.

loans.name: Deggo 1 Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité Deggo1 a été créé le 16/06/2009.IL regroupe 22 femmes issues du même village.Leurs activités sont :le commerce,l'agriculture et l'élevage.

Madame ASTOU est responsable du groupement,elle est âgée de 28 ans,elle est mariée et mére d'un enfant.Son activité est l'élevage des moutons.

Elle dispose d'une bonne expérience de cette activité pour l'avoir pratiqué pendant longtemps.

Son pret lui permettra d'acheter 2 moutons de son choix afin d'agrandir son cheptel.

Son objectif est d'assurer la scolarité de son enfant.
texts.en:
The Deggo 1 solidarity group was created on June 16, 2009. It consists of 22 women from the same village who conduct trade, farming and cattle rearing.

Mrs Astou chairs the group. She is 28 years old, married and the mother of one child. She rears sheep. After many years in this activity she has a lot of experience. She will use her loan to buy two sheep that she selects herself in order to expand her livestock. Her objective is to send her child to school.

loans.use: to buy two sheep.

loans.name: Sira Diawara Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité Sira  a été créé le 04/01/2010.IL est composé de 32 femmes issues du même village.Leur activité principale est le commerce.

Madame Sokhna en position debout, habillée en écharpe jaune sur la photo et à l'extreme droite , est responsable du groupement,elle est âgée de  56 ans,elle est veuve et s'occupe de 06 enfants.
Son activité à elle est l'agriculture,elle cultive de l'arachide qu'elle revend par la suite.

Elle dispose d'une bonne expérience de ce type d'activité pour l'avoir pratiqué depuis sa jeunesse.

Son pret lui permettra de s'approvisionner en quantité suffisante de semences d'arachide pour préparer son champ.

Son objectif est d'assurer la prise en charge familiale en assurant la scolarité de ses enfants et leur santé.
texts.en:
The Sira D. solidarity group was created on January 4, 2010. It consists of 32 women from the same village who mainly conduct trade.

Mrs Sokhna, standing on the far right-hand side of the photo and wearing a yellow scarf, chairs the group. She is 56 years old, widowed and has six children in her care. She is a farmer, growing and selling groundnuts. After having been in this activity since her youth she has a lot of experience. She will use her loan to buy a sufficiently large quantity of groundnut seeds for her field. Her objective is to care for her family, providing education and healthcare to her children.

loans.use: to buy groundnut seeds.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is 37 years old and engaged in a sari-sari (variety) store for two years. She usually sells vinegar, salt, canned goods and chips. She wants to add to her current goods to attract more customers in order to earn a higher income, so Marilyn is requesting a loan of P7,000 from Alalay sa Kaunlaran Inc. to buy biscuits, soft drinks, cooking oil and breads as additional goods to sell in her store.

She wishes to uplift her family from poverty, thus she is working hard to provide for the needs of her children especially in their educational needs.She hopes that with the help of this loan amount, she will reach her desired income for the betterment of their living conditions.

loans.use: to buy biscuits, soft drinks, cooking oil and breads as additional goods to sell in her store.

loans.name: Janeth

texts.en:
Janeth is 39 years old and works as a female motorcycle operator. She says, “If others can do it, I can do it also because I am determined to do it.” She is quietly different because of her strong determination. Being a female motorcycle operator is difficult but through her dedication and affection for her two children, she can work as a man.

She wants her children to finish their desired courses and attain their dreams. Therefore, she needs to work hard to earn a higher income daily. Through working every day, her motorcycle also deteriorates so Janet is asking for a loan in the amount of P5,000 to buy oil, paint and steel parts for maintenance of her motorcycle to continue her operations.

She hopes it will strengthen her income daily to bring success to their poor lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy oil, paint and steel parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle.

loans.name: Yohana

texts.en:
Yohana, a 36-year-old lady who is married to Edy, a 38-year-old man, is the mother of four children: Beny, 10, in the fourth grade of Elementary School; Evy, 7, in the second grade of Elementary School; Lena, 3 and Feny, 1 year old. The family lives in a very simple house comprised of a zinc roof, ground floor and palm tree branches.

Eight years ago, with a small amount of capital from her husband, Yohana started a small kiosk business selling goods such as noodles, sugar, coffee, snacks, cigarettes, detergent, soap, etc. She is grateful that the income generated from this business can assist her husband in meeting their daily needs.

Yohana is planning to improve her business by adding more products, and so is requesting a loan of IDR 5,000,000 to purchase items such as rice, kerosene, sugar, coffee, wheat flour, eggs, cigarettes, etc. She has repaid all previous loans from TLM’s Group Lending Program, and really hopes that TLM will continue to support her efforts to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase more products for her business such as rice, kerosene, sugar, coffee, wheat flour, eggs, cigarettes, etc.

loans.name: James

texts.en: James is a reliable businessman who is 45 years old. He is married and blessed with four children. For the last 13 years, he has been operating a carpentry business to support his family. His other source of income is farming. In the next 5 years, he wants the money he earns to educate his children. His dream is to buy a plot of land. He is requesting a loan of 50,000 Kenyan shillings to buy wood. Thanks to Faulu Kenya, he has become financially stable.

loans.use: To buy wood.

loans.name: Amelia

texts.en:
Amelia is 55 years old and raises pigs as her source of income. She is blessed with two children whom she needs to send to school and support. So Amelia, together with her husband, works to earn a higher income to improve their lives. Her husband works as a farmer while she focuses on her pig business.

She wants to provide good nutrition to her pigs so she is requesting a loan amount of PHP5,000 to buy feed and vitamins. By providing a nutritious diet for her pigs, she can sell them for a higher price. She hopes to gain higher sales and save money for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy spare parts and clothing for sale.

loans.name: Emil

texts.ru: Emil rodilsya v 1978 qodu. On jenat no ne imeyet detey. Emil jivet v Baku regione vmeste so svoyey jenoy. Uje 7 let kak on imeyet magazin i samje rabotayet v nem. Emil seychas nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi rasshirit pomesheniye magazina dlya razmesheniya razlichnix tovarov.
texts.en: Emil was born in 1978.  He is married, but does not have children.  Emil lives in the Baku region together with his wife.  He has owned a store, where he works, for seven years.  Emil now needs 2000 AZN in order to expand his store space to make room for various merchandise.

loans.use: to expand his store space

loans.name: Severino

texts.en:
“You will win through ambition and perseverance,” is the expression of a 50-year-old man who is engaged in raising poultry, such as ducks and chickens. He believes this is true because most of the highly successful people he knows are ambitious and persevere. He hopes that someday he will be one of those people. Through his ambition and perseverance, he hopes to lift his family from the difficulty of life.

Aside from his poultry business, he is also engaged in farming. He is able to work in both of these occupations through his perseverance. He dreams of expanding his poultry business so he is requesting a loan of PHP5,000 to buy ducks and chickens. Part of the loan will also be used to build a shelter for his poultry.

He hopes to win this battle of improving their living conditions and in satisfying this gift of life that God has given to him.

loans.use: to buy ducks and chickens.

loans.name: Ike

texts.en:
Ike is 25 years old and operates a 3-wheeled motorcycle as a source of income. He earns PHP200 daily to buy food and pay his electric bill. This income is not enough to provide for the daily needs of his family members, so he is working hard to increase his income potential every day.

His motorcycle needs maintenance, so Ike would like a loan of PHP3,000 to buy oil, paint and new tires for his 3-wheeled motorcycle. He hopes that this will help him to attract more customers to generate a higher income for his family’s living expenses.

loans.use: to buy oil, paint and new tires for his 3-wheeled cycle.

loans.name: Vincent

texts.en:
Vincent lives in a barrio where he has a pig business as his primary source of income. He has not been able to find a better job because he has just finished high school. He comes from an underprivileged family and thus was never able to attend college.

At the age of 24, he got married and now has his own family. He needs to work hard to provide for the needs of his family. He aims to be a good provider. He also wants to provide for his pigs' needs and is asking for a loan of PHP3,000 to buy them feed and vitamins. 

He hopes this will make them healthy and help to provide a better income for his family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for his pigs.

loans.name: Mose

texts.en:
Mose is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity and nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees. 

For the past three years, she has operated a clothing business, selling door-to-door to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of transportation in her business. She dreams of becoming self-reliant in the future.

With Kshs 60,000 she wants to purchase bundles of clothing for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of clothing for resale.

loans.name: Altansukh

texts.en:
Mr. Altansukh is 41 years old, and lives with his wife and two children in UIaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He has been running a taxi business since 2009 and used to work as a vendor in a private food production company. Altansukh tries to work hard and he does not take days off. His daughter, Binderya, is an accounting student at the university, while his son, Khash-Erdene, is a pupil in secondary school. 

Recently he has requested a loan to renovate part of his house. He wants to convert his hallway to a dining room with a gas furnace. This would be important for his family's finances, as well as their living conditions, and harmless to the environment. Also he is planning to insulate the walls. Therefore he needs funding to purchase building materials such as brick, cement, sand and iron pipes.

loans.use: To purchasing building materials such as brick, cement, sand and iron pipe to renovate his house.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en: Paul is a hardworking businessman who is 57 years old. He is married and blessed with five children. For the last two years, he has been managing a taxi business to earn a living. His other source of income is from selling clothes. In the next five years, he wants to buy another vehicle for his business. His dream is to expand his business. He is requesting a loan of 50,000 Kenyan shillings to buy clothes for resale. Faulu Kenya has enabled him to become more business-oriented.

loans.use: To buy clothing for resale.

loans.name: Davaadorj

texts.en:
Mr. Davaadorj is 28 years old and does two jobs: working in construction and driving a taxi when he has no work. He lives with his two children and his wife in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. His two kids are infants, so he decided to build a new house to provide better living conditions for his family than they had last year. He needs additional funding to finish building his house. 
Davaadorj is taking a loan to purchase the building materials he needs.

loans.use: To purchase materials to finish building his house.

loans.name: Fatimatou

texts.fr:
Fatimatou est une femme âgée de 29 ans. Elle est mariée à un transitaire. Elle a 2 enfants. 
Fatimatou  travaille comme revendeuse depuis 2009. Elle vend des pagnes et des bazins à toutes les personnes à la maison. Elle achète les pagnes au grand marché de Lomé, au Niger et au Mali.
Fatimatou a requis son premier crédit à WAGES afin d’acheter des pagnes et des bazins.
Dans les prochaines années, Fatimatou voudrait étendre son activité. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, Elle prévoit rendre sa famille heureuse.
texts.en:
Fatimatou,  29, is married to a dispatcher and has two children. 
 
Fatimatou  has been in sales since 2009. She sells lengths of African print cloth and "damask" cloth to all comers at her house. She buys the cloth in the Grand market in Lomé, in Niger, and in Mali.

Fatimatou has requested her first loan from WAGES in order to buy more lengths of African print cloth and "damask" cloth. In the coming years, she would like to expand her business. She says that with her profit, she intends to make her family happy.

loans.use: to buy lengths of African print cloth and "damask" cloth.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase wheat flour, cooking oil, sugar, charcoal and utensils.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en: Alice is a 57-year-old business woman. She is married with six children. For the last 19 years she has been farming to make a living. She has been able to retain her business with the financial support from Faulu Kenya. In the next 5 years she wants to expand her business. She is requesting a loan of 35,000 Kenya shillings to buy fertilizer, manure, and pesticide.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, manure, and pesticide.

loans.name: Murman

texts.en:
Murman is from the village of Gantiadi, South Georgia. He is 27-years-old and lives with his wife Khatuna and their children – a 6-year-old daughter and three sons, are ages 4, 3, and 1. 

Agriculture is the only source of income for the family. They own a small dairy farm with two milk cows and 1.5 hectares of land where potatoes are grown. They sell milk to local dairy product retailers and the potatoes are sold in Tbilisi (capital city of the country). 

Murman requests a loan to pay for harvesting and transporting the potatoes. He will pay the owner of a tractor to help him harvest and a truck driver to  take them to his store house. 

Also part of the loan (approximately 45%) will be used for purchasing wood for the oven during the winter. The oven is the only means of heating the house in Murman’s village. 

Murman worked hard all year and the weather conditions were favorable so he will have a good harvest. He hopes to sell it for a good price and make a good profit for the well-being of his four children.

loans.use: to pay for harvesting and transporting potatoes for selling, and to purchase wood for heat in the winter.

loans.name: Clarence

texts.en:
Clarence is a former overseas Filipino worker in Lebanon. During her 10 years there, she earned enough money to build her desired business. When she got home, she started a restaurant in the marketplace as a source of income. 

At first, she struggled to promote her restaurant because she was new in the business. But as time passed, she learned more about the business and how to attract customers. She earns P10,000 every month and usually uses it for the education of her four children. 

To increase sales, she is requesting a loan amount of P15,000 to buy meat and vegetables to cook, and to buy dishes, glasses, and pottery to use in her restaurant. She hopes it will contribute to a better income in order to save for emergency and educational purposes.

loans.use: buy meat and vegetables to cook, and buy dishes, glasses, and pottery to use in her restaurant.

loans.name: Samson

texts.en: Samson is a 49-year-old business man. He is married with three children. For the last 17 years, he has been operating a tailoring business and he mainly makes sacks. In the next 5 years, he wants to expand his business into wholesale. He is requesting a loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings to buy materials for making sacks.

loans.use: To buy materials for making sacks.

loans.name: Uyanga

texts.en:
Uyanga has requested a loan to purchase equipment for her beauty salon which is called Uyanga. It is located in Darkhan, the second largest city in Mongolia. 

She opened her salon in 2008. Before that she used to work as a beautician in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She has a lot of experience in this business. 

She needs to buy equipment to help increase her salon output and income. It is important to her to expand her business. 

Uyanga lives with her husband and son in her in-laws' house.

loans.use: To buy equipment for her beauty salon to help increase her salon output and income.

loans.name: Murman

texts.en:
Murman is from the village Shindisi, Gori District, East Georgia. He is 65 years old and lives with his family: wife Tina, a 34 year-old daughter and a two-year old grandson. Murman’s daughter and grandson are internally displaced persons from Samatchablo and they receive monthly financial assistance from the state (80 Laris). All adult family members are involved in family farming activities. They own 5 hectares of land where wheat, beans, tomato, cabbage, cherry and and cornel trees are grown. Murman sells harvested fruits and vegetables to the local retail greengrocers. Total monthly income of the family is 980 Laris. 

Murman has requested a loan to purchase fertilizers and pesticides to treat his plants for parasites. Also, a small part of the loan will be used to pay the salary of a worker to help him in fertilizing the land. After properly done seasonal work, Murman will get high quality products and sell them for a good price. The family will get planned income, which will be used by them during the year, untill the next harvest season.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and pesticide to treat plants for parasites

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en: Joyce is a business woman aged 46. She is married and blessed with four children. For the last three years, she has been selling cereals to bring up the family. In the next 5 years, she wants to expand her business. Her dream is to open a supermarket. She is requesting for a loan of 50,000 Kenya shillings to buy bags of beans and maize. Thanks to Faulu Kenya, she has become more business oriented.

loans.use: To buy bags of beans and maize

loans.name: John

texts.en: John is a business man aged 61. He is married and blessed with three children. For the last 25 years, he has been doing farming to earn a living. In the next 5 years, he wants to be the supplier of fruits in his region. His dream is to buy a piece of land and use it for farming. He is requesting for a loan of 80,000 Kenya shillings to buy cows and manure. Thanks to Faulu Kenya, he has been able to improve his business with his previous loans.

loans.use: To buy cows and manure

loans.name: Nino

texts.en:
Nino is from the village Tsromi, East Georgia. She is 57 years old and lives with her family: husband Mikhail and 29 year-old son. 

Nino is leading the family agricultural business. The family has two cows and two calves. She produces cheese and sells it in Khashuri (nearby town) open market. Also Nino and Mikhail grow beans, maize, potatoes and onions on the family's two-hectare land. They sell the harvested products in Khashuri as well. Nino’s son works mainly on house renovation in his, and nearby, villages. Mikhail repairs the engines of cars. Total average income of the family is 800 Laris per month.

Nino has requested credit for house renovation, as their house is old. She will purchase the  relevant materials and her son will renovate the house. Mikhail and Nino will assist him during the process. After the renovation the family will have improved living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase meterials for house renovation

loans.name: Modou

texts.fr:
Modou est commercant dans un marche au sud du senegal qui vent des vetement chausures avec moins de force,Modou a demande un credit a UIMCEC pour augment sa quantite des vetements : pantalons, des chemises,   chaussures pour les enfants et les adultes.Il achette des marchandises à dakar ou dans une grande ville au sud du senegal

Modou est un marie avec quatres enfants 2 garçons 2 filles dont un garçon qui est l'ecole coranique une fille qui soutienne sa mere dans son commerce au marché les deux autres enfants une fille et un garçon pour d'autres occupations dans la maison.

Modou veut developper son commerce en esperant des credit beaucoup plus consequents pour lui aider à maximiser les opportinites  ammener par la fete prochaine de Tabaski,la fete des moutons,qui est tres important au senegal.
texts.en:
Modou is a salesperson in a market in the south of Senegal. He sells clothing and shoes. Modou has asked for a loan from UIMCEC to add to his stock of clothing: pants, shirts, and shoes for children and adults. He buys his merchandise in Dakar or in a big town in the south of Senegal. 

Modou is married with four children, two boys and two girls. One of his sons is attending a Koranic school. One daughter helps her mother in her small-scale retail business in the marketplace. The other two children help around the house. 

Modou wants to grow his business and hopes that even bigger loans will help him to maximize the opportunities offered by the feast of Tabaski (the Feast of the Lamb) which is very important in Senegal.

loans.use: to add to his stock of clothing and shoes.

loans.name: Ibrahima

texts.fr:
Ibrahima est un commerçant dans un marché d'une grande ville au sud du sénégal depuis 5 ans.Ibrahima est un père de 4 enfants 3 filles qui sont à l'école et le plus petit est un garçon qui est à la maison.Ibrahima a 36 ans et il est tres fiert de ses enfants.

Ibrahima achete ses marchandises en grande quantite dans la capitale du sénégal ou à Ziguinchor dans le sud du sénégal.Il veut accroitre son chiffre d'affaires d'ici 2 ans pour le bien étre de sa famille.
texts.en:
Ibrahima has been a salesperson in the marketplace of a big town in the south of Senegal for five years. He is the father of four children, three daughters who are at school and a son who is still very young and stays at home. Ibrahima is 36 and he is very proud of his children. 

Ibrahima buys his merchandise in bulk in the capital of Senegal or in Ziguinchor in the south of Senegal. He wants to grow his turnover over the next two years for the well-being of his family.

loans.use: To buy pants, shirts, shoes, etc. to expand his shop.

loans.name: Aliou

texts.fr:
Aliou est un père de 3 enfants dont 2 sont à l'école, une fille et un garçon,le plus petit reste à la maison avec sa maman. Aliou a 37 ans et il a travaillé tres fort dans toute sa vie pour l'avenir de ses enfants.Aliou prétendre à des crédits beaucoup plus important pour développer son commerce.

Aliou dans SA boutique il vent des produits de ménage:comme des bols,les marmites, équimoires cuilléres mortiés ,les pilons etc

Depuis 10 ans il est dans le commerce de détail ou il gagne de l'argent pour payer les frais de scolarisation de ses enfants et des dépenses de la famille.
texts.en:
Aliou is the father of three children, of whom two are at school, a daughter and a son, and the youngest stays at home with his mother. Aliou is 37 and he has worked very hard all his life for the future of his children. He hopes to receive even much bigger loans to grow his business. 

In his shop Aliou sells household goods such as basins, pots, slotted spoons, mortars and pestles, etc. 

For 10 years he has been in the retail sales business and it allows him to earn money to pay the school fees for his children and cover other family expenses.

loans.use: to increase the stock of his little shop with household equipment such as basins, mortars and pestles, etc.

loans.name: Chhin

texts.en:
Chhin, 29, is living in Prey Chor District, Kompong Cham Province, Cambodia. She lives with Pheap, 39, and their two children, which they care for and provide with a good education.

Chhin strives to provide the best for her family members. She works hard for them in her fields planted with rice, corn and potatoes. She’s been in this line of work for many years on land of her own. From this business she earns approximately $2 per day. Due to the rainy season, Chhin would like to purchase seeds, fertilizer and other materials for supporting her farm, but she has a lack of money, so she wishes to request some funds through HKL, a Kiva partner.

This is her first loan with HKL so she’s hoping for a small loan to reach her objectives, and she is naturally most disposed to repay her loan punctually. She hopes that this loan will help her family have happiness and prosperity all the time. In the future, she will send her children to study at a higher level. She is shown with her husband.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizer and other materials

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Anna is from the village Mashavera, East Georgia. She is 63 years old, married and lives with his husband, Anzor. Anna and Anzor are bee-keepers. They have 30 bee-hives with bee-colonies and sell on average 450 liters of Honey per year. They sell it locally, retailers, as well as to the local population. Along with the bee-keeping business, Anna is busy with trade. She has a grocery store in the village, where she sells various grocery products.

Anna has requested a loan to increasing the store's inventory. She will increase the assortment of products in the store. It will increase sales and consequently the profit of the business. Anna plans to use the increased income for further expansion of the bee-keeping business through purchasing of additional bee-hives and bee-colonies.

loans.use: to purchase grocery products to increase her inventory

loans.name: Oganes

texts.en:
Oganes is 46 years old. He lives in the village of Krasnoe (East Georgia) with his wife Margarita and their 25-year-old son. 

Oganes is a tailor. He has his own sewing workshop. Oganes designs various types of seasonal clothes and sells them in his village. The average monthly income of the family is 800 Laris. 

Oganes requested credit to purchase a car. He will take his clothes to the nearby villages and towns and sell them there. Oganes hopes that by using the car, he will be able to double the sales of his clothes. He thinks that he has enough production capacity to satisfy the doubled demand. The income of the family will increase and they will improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase a car for transportation of his products

loans.name: Anvar

texts.ru: Anvar jenat i imeyet 2 detey. On yavlyayetsya IDP personom pereselenec iz Fuzuli qoroda, seychas projivayet v Fuzuli regione vmeste so svoyey semyoy. Anvar 49 let. Uje 11 et kak on zanimayetsya skotovodstvom i razvodit korov. Seychas on nujdayetysa v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit korovi dlya uvelicheniya kolichestva skota.
texts.en: Anvar is married and has two children.  He is an IDP (Internally Displaced Person) from the city of Fuzuli and now lives in the Fuzuli region together with his family.  Anvar is 49 years old.  He has been involved in animal husbandry for 11 years and breeds cattle.  Currently, he needs 2000 AZN in order to buy cows to increase quantity of livestock.

loans.use: to buy cows

loans.name: Rudik

texts.en:
Rudik requested credit for the expansion of a family-owned pig farm. 

Rudik is 45 years old, married, and lives with his family in the village of Shaumiani, East Georgia. His family consists of himself, his wife Sirush, and their 25-year-old son Edik. Edik is a shoe-maker and works in the village.

Rudik and Sirush lead the pig farm owned by the family. They have seven pigs and sell on average 70 piglets per year. At the same time the family owns a fruit garden. Rudik sells harvested fruit locally to greengrocer retailers. The total average monthly income of the family is 800 Laris. 

With the requested credit Rudik will purchase five to six piglets and feed for them. Rudik will raise the piglets and after a year will be able to increase the price of the piglets by 70-80%. The income of the family will increase by 50 to 60%. It will positively affect the family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase 5-6 piglets and feed for them

loans.name: Mikhuyu Group

texts.en:
Allan is the facilitator for Mikhuyu Group in Chwele. This group joined One Acre Fund in 2011. Allan says that he joined in order to access good input prices, have access to hybrid seed and fertilizer, grow enough to feed his family, and have additional profits to spend on school fees.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important farming inputs to distribute to Allan and his group during Kenya's next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund's integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance. 

Allan joined One Acre Fund in order to access good input prices, grow enough to feed his family, have profits for school fees, and have inputs delivered right to his village market.

Allan has not yet harvested his 2011 maize, but expects that it will yield 8-10 bags on 1/2 acre.  

Allan says that he hopes to use the profits from his harvest to pay for his children's education, repair his home, save for the future, invest in livestock, and increase his investments in farming.

loans.use: to source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season

loans.name: Vilaiat

texts.en:
Vilaiat lives in the village of Zemo Sarali, Kartli region, in the eastern part of the country. He is 55 years old, married, and lives with his wife Mushkunaz and their 14-year-old daughter, who goes to school. 

Vilaiat works as a construction worker in the village. At the same time, he is involved in the farming activities of the family. They own two milk cows. Mushkunaz produces cheese from the milk and sells on average 30 kg of it per month in the village. Also the family has rented a plot of land, where Vilaiat grows watermelon and maize. He uses maize in the dairy farm for feeding the cows. Watermelon is sold to greengrocer retailers locally. The total average monthly income of the family is 600 Laris. 

Vilaiat requested credit for the construction of a cattle shed, as in the future he plans to purchase more cows and the existing cattle-shed doesn't have enough space. Also part of the credit will be used for construction of a greenhouse where vegetables will be grown in the fall and winter months. 

New business activities initiated through a Kiva loan will significantly increase the income of the family. They will be able to spend more on improving their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase materials for cattle-shed and greenhouse construction

loans.name: Elsevar

texts.ru: Elsevar yavlyayetsya IDP personom on pereselenec iz Fuzuli goroda, seychas projivayet v Fuzuli regione vmeste so svoyey semyoy. On jenat i imeyet 2 detey. Elsevar rodilsya v 1974 qodu. On uje 7 let kak zanimayetsya skotovodstvom i razvodit korov. Seychas on nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit korovi dlya razvitiya svoyego biznessa. Etomu biznessu on nauchilsya u svoyego otca kotoriy toje zanimalsya skotovodstvom.
texts.en: Elsevar is an IDP (Internally Displaced Person) from the city of Fuzuli and now lives in the Fuzuli region together with his family.  He is married and has two children.  Elsevar was born in 1974.  He has been involved in animal husbandry for seven years and breeds cattle.  Currently, he needs 2000 AZN in order to buy cattle to develop his business.  He learned this business from his father, who is also involved in animal husbandry.

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Chemwa Mwangaza A Group

texts.en:
Benjamin is the facilitator for Chemwa Mwangaza A group in Chwele.  He and his fellow group members joined One Acre Fund in 2011.  Benjamin says that he joined One Acre Fund in order to access good input prices and to grow enough to feed his family.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important farming inputs to distribute to Benjamin and his group during Kenya's next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund's integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance. 

Benjamin has not yet harvested his 2011 maize, but expects between 8-10 bags on his 1/2 acre.  With the profits from his harvests, Benjamin will invest in the education of his children, buy livestock, and improve his current living situation.

In total, Chemwa Mwangaza A group will plant 5.25 acres in 2012, with each farmer planting between 1/2 and 1 acre of land.  

In the background of this photo, you will notice a pile of recently harvested maize from one of Benjamin's group members!

loans.use: to source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane, 32 and single, is a determined businesswoman. For the last three years, she has been managing a boutique to make a living. In the next five years, she wants to expand her business to several branches. 

She is requesting a loan of 60,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) to buy bags and shoes. Thanks to Faulu Kenya, she has been able to access loans which have helped her to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy bags and shoes

loans.name: Cheikh

texts.fr:
Cheikh est commerçant;depuis l'age de 5 ans il est dans le commerce avec son pére et ses 3 fréres dans le magasin de leur pére . Par la suite il a quitté le magasin pour fair son commerce personnel.

Cheikh est un célibataire sans enfant depuis 10 ans il fait son propre commerce; il veut persévérance dans le travail quotidienne en vue d'accroitre son commerce.Il achete des marchandises à dakar ou dans une ville du sud pour augmenter sa boutique parce que toujours sa demande supérieur à l'offre.

Cheikh veut avoir une grande boutique et construir sa propre maison avant de se marié.
texts.en:
Cheikh is a retailer. Since the age of five, he was in business with his father and his three brothers in their father's store. Later on he left that store to set up his own business. 

Cheikh is single with no children. For 10 years he has had his own business. He wants to persevere in his daily work so as to grow that business. He buys his merchandise at Dakar or in a city in the south to add to his stock since his customers' demand is always greater than he can supply. 

Cheikh wants to have a big store and build his own house before he marries.

loans.use: to buy coolers, glasses, thermoses, etc. wholesale to grow his stock.

loans.name: Edward

texts.en:
Edward is 31, married, and has two children. He has been a farmer for the past three years. He has applied for 50,000 Kenyan Shillings (KES) which he will use to buy farm inputs like seeds and fertilizer. With the anticipated profits generated he plans to pay school fees for his children. 

He dreams of being a prominent farmer.

loans.use: buy farm inputs like seeds and ferilizer

loans.name: Wangninan 16 Group

texts.fr: Le groupe WANGNINAN 16  est composé  de sept  personnes qui  vivent dans la même localité, et qui font la transformation de noix de palme en huile de palme ensemble au Bénin. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Mondoukpè  est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Mondoukpè est âgée de 25 ans et vit au Bénin. Mondoukpè est mariée à un maçon du nom de Valentin. Le couple a un enfant, scolarisé et à leur  charge. Mondoukpè vit ensemble avec son mari et son enfant. Mondoukpè n’a jamais été à l’école. Pour subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de son enfant, Mondoukpè vend depuis dix ans des articles divers (riz, conserves, huile etc.) à son domicile. De façon secondaire, Mondoukpè mène comme activité la transformation de noix de palme et la vente d'huile de palme. Mondoukpè s’approvisionne au Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Mondoukpè  sollicite, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe WANGNINAN 16, un crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
The WANGNINAN 16 group is made up of seven persons who come from the same locality and who work at several businesses in common: producing palm oil from palm buts in  Bénin. The leader of the group, Mondoukpè, is raising her hand in the photo. 

 Mondoukpè, 25, lives in Bénin and is married to a mason named Valentin. The couple has one child who is enrolled in school and lives under their roof. 

 Mondoukpè lives together with her husband and child. She never went to school. To support herself and her child, Mondoukpè has been selling various goods for 10 years (rice, canned food, oil, etc.) out of her home. Secondarily she processes palm nuts and sells palm oil. She buys her supplies in Bénin. 

Wishing to satisfy the needs of her clientele and grow her turnover and her income,  Together with the other members of the group called WANGNINAN 16, Mondoukpè is requesting a loan from ALIDé.

loans.use: to buy various foodstuffs (rice, canned foods, palm nuts, etc.)

loans.name: Julius

texts.en: Julius is 64 years old and married with five children.  He operates a butchery to earn a living for his family. He also practices livestock farming for more income.  He has employed one person to assist him in the business.  He hopes to open other butcheries in the future.  He has requested a loan of 80,000 Kenyan shillings to buy cows.

loans.use: To buy cows

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy shoes, clothes and bags.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en: Nancy is 37 years old and married with two children who go to school. She does tailoring to earn a living for her family. She has been in the business for the last year and has employed one person. She has become financially literate because she has been attending financial training conducted by Faulu Kenya.  This has helped her to manage her finances by saving.  She hopes to expand her business and employ more people.  She has requested a loan of 80,000 Kenya shillings to buy fabric.

loans.use: To buy fabric

loans.name: Charles

texts.en: Charles is a determined businessman, age 46. He is married and blessed with five children. For the last 17 years, he has been operating a tailoring business to earn a living. He has employed three people to help him to operate the business. In the next five years, he wants to expand his business and own a plot. He is requesting a loan of 50,000 Kenyan shillings to buy fabric. Thanks to Faulu Kenya, he has become financially stable.

loans.use: To buy fabric

loans.name: Kondokpogbe Group

texts.fr: Le groupe KONDOKPOGBE est composé de  trois  personnes qui  sont des amies et qui vivent dans le même quartier  au Bénin. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Sègbégnon Blanche  est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Sègbégnon  Blanche est âgée de 34 ans  et vit au Bénin. Sègbégnon  Blanche est mariée à un Mécanicien du nom de Paul.  Le couple a deux  enfants  à leur  charge. L’un des enfants est scolarisé.  Sègbégnon  Blanche et son mari vivent ensemble avec leurs enfants.  Sègbégnon  Blanche n’a jamais été à l’école. Pour  subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants,  Sègbégnon  Blanche vend depuis sept ans  de l’huile d’arachide.  A côté de cette activité, Sègbégnon  Blanche  vend des chaussures et du charbon de bois dans sa boutique. Sègbégnon  Blanche s’approvisionne au Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu, Sègbégnon  Blanche sollicite, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe KONDOKPOGBE, un troisième crédit.  Les crédits reçus antérieurement ont été bien remboursé.
texts.en: The KONDOKPOGBE group is made up of 3 friends who live in the same neighbourhood in Benin. The representative of the group, whose name is Sègbégnon Blanche, is the one with her hand raised in the photo. Sègbégnon Blanche is 34 years old and lives in Benin. She is married to mechanic called Paul. The couple have 2 children in their care, one of which attends school. Sègbégnon Blanche and her husband live together with their children. She has never attended school. To provide for her needs and those of her children, Sègbégnon Blanche has been selling peanut oil for the past 7 years.  In addition to this, Sègbégnon Blanche sells shoes and charcoal in a shop. She sources her products from Benin. In order to satisfy her clientele and to increase her sales and revenue, Sègbégnon Blanche is requesting, along with the other members of the KONDOKPOGBE group, a third loan. The previous loans have all been duly repaid.

loans.use: Acheter  de l'huile d'arachide, des chaussures et des habits.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en: Samuel, who is 27 years old and single, has been operating a motorbike transport business for four years to earn a living.  He also farms to earn extra income.  Through Faulu Kenya, Samuel has learnt how to save his money, and has been able to access loans easily.  Now requesting a loan of 50,000 Kenya shillings to buy a motorbike, he hopes to own a van in five years to use in the transport business.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for labor to prepare the land for farming

loans.name: Edwige Bernadette

texts.fr:
Cliente de 41 ans, divorcée et mère de 2 enfants dont l’âge varie entre 28 et 32 ans. 
Étant mariée très  jeune en 2009, elle divorce avec son mari  et  pour  prendre en charge la scolarité de ses enfants qui sont a l’université, elle se lance dans le commerce des divers comme les filets d’oignons, tomate, du poisson fume , du poisson sale, de l' haricot. …
Ses ventes sont de 20.000frs à 50.000 frs par jour.
Avec le prêt obtenu elle va acheter des filets d’oignons, des cartons de poissons sales, des paniers de poissons sales, un sac haricot de 50kg, des cartons de tomate.

Très entreprenante, elle tient à aller loin avec son commerce, et a pour ambition de devenir grossiste.
texts.en:
This 41-year-old borrower is a divorced mother of two children aged 28 and 32. Having married very young, she divorced her husband in 2009. 

To support her children’s college education, she started selling various food items such as onions, tomatoes, smoked fish, salted fish, and beans. Her sales average 20,000 to 50,000 francs per day.

She will use this loan to buy bags of onions, cartons of salted fish, baskets of smoked fish, a 50 kg bag of beans, and cartons of tomatoes.

A very enterprising woman, she has big plans for her business and hopes someday to become a wholesaler

loans.use: to buy bags of onions, cartons of salted fish, baskets of smoked fish, bags of beans, and cartons of tomatoes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy lumber to make beds, tables, dressers, etc.

loans.name: Julius

texts.en: Julius is 31 years old and married three children. He owns a bicycle, which he uses in his business when he sells firewood.  He also does livestock farming for more income generation. He has been in the business for three years. He joined a group in Faulu Kenya where he saves his money on a weekly basis. He is able to access loans easily because the members of the group guarantee each other's loans. He has requested a loan of 30,000 Kenyan shillings, which he will use to buy cows and more firewood.

loans.use: To buy cows and firewood

loans.name: Mignonmide 1 Group

texts.fr: Le groupe MIGNONMIDE 1 est composé de  quatre  personnes qui font ensemble la transformation de noix de palme en huile de palme et de manioc en farine de manioc au Bénin. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Agnès  est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Agnès  est âgée de 29  ans  et vit au Bénin. Agnès  est mariée à un certain Barthélemy.  Le couple a quatre  enfants qui vivent ensemble avec eux. Parmi les enfants, certains sont scolarisés. Agnès n’a jamais été à l’école. Pour subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants, Agnès produit depuis sept ans environs, de l'huile de palme qu'elle vend à son domicile. Agnès s’approvisionne en noix de palme dans une ville du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Agnès sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe MIGNONMIDE 1, un crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en: The Mignonmide 1 group consists of four individuals from Benin who work together  processing palm nuts  into palm oil and manioc [cassava] into manioc flour. The group’s representative, by the name of Agnès, is the one raising her hand in the photo. Agnès is 29 years old and lives in Benin. She is married to Barthélemy. The spouses live together with their four children. Some of the children go to school. Agnès never attended school. In order to provide for herself and he children, since about seven years ago Agnès makes palm oil and sells it out of her home. She stocks up on palm nuts in a town of Benin. In order to satisfy her customers’ needs and to increase her sales volume and he revenues, Agnès, together with other members of the Mignonmide 1 group, is seeking a loan from ALIDé.

loans.use: to buy palm nuts

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more vegetables and fruits to sell

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 37 years-old and married with four children.  To earn a living for her family, she farms.  She has eight years of experience in farming.  She has retained her business through her hard work and determination.  She hopes to expand her farming to a larger-scale.

She has requested a loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings in order to buy seeds and pay for labour.

loans.use: to buy seeds and pay for labour.

loans.name: Jean Edmond

texts.fr:
Client de 51 ans , célibataire avec 4 enfants dont l’âge varie entre 2 et 25 ans, a l’arrêt de ses études en classe de 3eme, son père qui était menuisier le place  dans son propre atelier pour apprentissage  et a la fin de son apprentissage il a toujours travaille avec son père, mais quand celui-ci meurt il hérite de l’atelier et étend l’atelier dans la fabrication de meubles, des cercueils et fait des charpente et toitures des maisons.
Ses recettes sont de 150.000 frs a 600.000 frs par semaine, quand les activités marchent.
Avec le prêt, il veut premièrement augmenter sa capacité de fabrication  en  achetant des bastings, du bois blancs des lattes, des contres plaques , des chevrons. 
Il a pour ambition d'agrandir son atelier et d'acheter une tour a bois.
texts.en:
This client is 51 years old, single, with 4 children aged between 2 and 25. 

When he finished his studies at the third level, his father, a cabinet maker, took him on in his workshop as an apprentice. At the end of his apprenticeship, he continued to work with his father and after his father's death, he inherited the workshop. Now, he has expanded to include furniture and coffins. He also makes house frames and roofs. 

When business is good, his weekly revenue is between 150,000 and 600,000 francs. With this loan, he wants to primarily increase his production capacity by buying molding, white wood and slats, plywood and herringbone wood. His ambition is to expand his workshop and to buy a lathe.

loans.use: to buy wood such as herringbone planks, molding, slats, white wood and red wood.

loans.name: Sena 2 Group

texts.fr: Le groupe SENA 2 est composé de  sept personnes qui vivent dans le même village et mènent certaines activités ensemble. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Micheline est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Micheline est âgée de 36 ans  et vit au Bénin. Micheline est mariée à un producteur agricole du nom de Bertin. Le couple a cinq enfants. Parmi les enfants, certains sont scolarisés. Micheline vit avec ses enfants et assure leurs différentes charges grâce au revenu que lui procure son activité. Micheline n’a jamais été à l’école. Pour  subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants,  Micheline vend depuis une dizaine d'année des noix de palme et des noix palmistes à son domicile. Micheline achète ses produits dans une ville du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu, Micheline sollicite, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe SENA 2, un troisième crédit. Les crédits reçus antérieurement ont été bien remboursé.
texts.en: The Sena 2 group is made up of seven people who live in the same village and carry out certain tasks together. The representative of the group who goes by the name of Micheline is the one with her hand raised in the photo.Micheline is 36 years old and lives in Benin. Micheline is married to a farmer called Bertin.The couple have five children. Some of the children go to school. Micheline lives with her children and meets their various expenses thanks to the income that her business provides. Micheline has never been to school. To provide for her needs and those of her children, for the last 10 years Micheline has sold palm nuts and palm kernels at her home. Micheline buys her stock in a town in Benin. In order to satisfy her customers and to increase her sales and her income, in associations with the other members of the group Sena 2, Micheline requests a third loan. The previous loans were correctly repaid.

loans.use: Purchase palm nuts and palm kernels.

loans.name: Swalehe

texts.en:
Swalehe is a married man with nine children, five of whom attend school and four of whom graduated from school. He lives in a rental house that has neither electricity nor running water. His greatest monthly expense is the rental bills.

For the past two years, he has operated a clothes-selling business, selling in a shop to his neighbours and passers-by. He faces a major challenge of high cost of transportation in his business. He dreams of expanding his business to improve his living standards. 

With the Kshs 20,000 he wants to purchase bundles of clothes for resale. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Loyce

texts.en:
Loyce is a married woman with seven children, all of whom graduated from school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is the high cost of transportation.

For the past ten years, she has operated a business of buying and selling maize at the market to her market dwellers and neighbours. She faces a major challenge from the high cost of transportation from the rural areas to her place of operation. She dreams of expanding her business to improve her living standards.

With the loan of Kshs 40,000 she wants to purchase sacks of maize for resale. She decided to join Kiva partner Yehu in order to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of maize to resell.

loans.name: Mwanamisi

texts.en:
Mwanamisi is a married woman with four children; two attend school while two are still young for school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water.

For the past six years, she has operated a retail shop business, selling to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge from the high cost of high cost of transportation for her business. She dreams of expanding her business in the future.

With the loan of Kshs 10,000 she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour and sugar. She decided to join Kiva partner Yehu in order to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour and sugar.

loans.name: Fifa Group

texts.fr: Le groupe FIFA est composé de cinq personnes qui vivent dans le même quartier au Bénin. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Rachelle est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Rachelle est âgée de 34 ans et vit au Bénin. Rachelle est mariée à un cultivateur du nom de Alfred. Le couple a cinq enfants à leur charge dont deux sont les leurs. Tous les enfants sont scolarisés et vivent ensemble avec leurs parents. Pour subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants, Rachelle vend depuis une douzaine d'année divers articles( lait, farine de manioc etc.) à son domicile et aussi dans un marché du Bénin. A côté de cette activité, Rachelle vend des chaussures et des tissus. Rachelle s’approvisionne au Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu, Rachelle sollicite, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe FIFA,un cinquième crédit. Les crédits reçus antérieurement ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en: The group FIFA is made up of five people who live in the same part of Bénin.   The representative of the group, Rachelle, is the one with her hand raised in the photo.  Rachelle is 34 years old and lives in Bénin.  Rachelle is married to a farmer by the name of Alfred.  The couple has five children in their care, two of whom are theirs. All the children go to school and live with their parents.  In order to meet her needs and those of her children, Rachelle has been selling, for about 12 years, various products (milk, flour, manioc flour, etc.) from her home and at the market in Bénin.  In addition to this work, Rachelle sells shoes and fabric. Rachelle gets her supplies in Bénin.  In order to satisfy the demand of her customers and to increase her turnover and revenue, Rachelle is requesting, along with the other members of the group FIFA, a fifth loan.  The previous loans have all been fully repaid.

loans.use: to buy various products (milk, flour, manioc flour etc.) and fabric.

loans.name: Simel

texts.en:
Simel,37 years-old is married with four children, two of whom are in school. He does mixed farming in that he raises sheep and farms wheat.  He has been doing this for the past seven years.

He learned about Kiva partner KADET LTD through a KADET staff member. He paid his previous loans successfully and has now applied for a fifth loan and he plans to spend part of the money farming and the remainder to purchase more sheep to raise and sell at a profit later.

He hopes to make a profit and use it to educate his children. He dreams to expand his business.

loans.use: to spend some money on farming and some to purchase more sheep.

loans.name: Felistus

texts.en:
Felistus is 33 years-old and married to Benrodgers.  They two children aged thirteen and eight years old.

She has been selling charcoal for the last five years making a monthly profit of KES.9,000 , she has been loaned KES.20,000 which she plans to use to purchase more sacks of charcoal to sell.

With the anticipated profit she intends to support her husband in the provision of the family's basic needs, expand her business and educate their children.  In the future she hopes to have a a stable business.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Turibamwe Group

texts.fr:
Lazare est un commerçant âgé de 59ans qui habite  la localité de Nyamugari au centre du pays dans la Province de Gitega. Il  fait le commerce de produits  alimentaires dans un restaurant depuis 7ans. Il faisait le commerce des produits alimentaires de boutique avant de commencer ce métier. Il a fréquenté l’école jusqu’en 6e année des études primaires. Il est et père de 13 enfants ; le 1er ayant 36 ans et le dernier avec 5ans.
 Le crédit Kiva  de 100,000 francs burundais qu’il obtient lui permet d’augmenter son capital en achetant une  plus grande quantité de produits alimentaires consommes dans le restaurant afin de  réaliser de grands bénéfices. 

Il est membre  du groupe  communautaire« TURIBAMWE»
texts.en:
Lazare is 59 years old.  He is a merchant and lives in the town of Nyamugari in the center of the country, in the province of Gitega.  He has been selling food products to a restaurant for seven years.  He sold food products from a shop before beginning this type of work.  He attended school up to the 6th year of primary studies.  He is the father of 13 children; the oldest is 36 years old and the youngest is five.

The loan of 100,000 Burundi francs that he will get will allow him to increase his working capital by buying a larger quantity of food products to be used in the restaurant.  This will mean large profits for him.
He is a member of the community group « TURIBAMWE».

loans.use: to increase his working capital by buying a larger quantity of food products to be used in the restaurant in order to make large profits.

loans.name: Kwale Group

texts.en:
Justus, who is in his mid-40's, is married.  He has had a tailoring business for three years.  He works from 9.30am to 6:00p.m daily and is able to make a very good monthly profit.

This will be his first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  He wants to use the loan for buying cloth so that he can make more ladies dresses.  His dream is to one day be able to build a house.

He will share this loan with his loan group "Kwale" which has a total of 13 members.  They will hold each other accountable for paying back their loans.

loans.use: to buy cloth in order to make more ladies dresses.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 41 years old.  He has been selling second hand shoes for the last two years making a monthly profit of KES 30,000.  He has been loaned KES 35,000 which he plans to stock children's school shoes as the new term is about to begin.

With the anticipated profit, he hopes to open a big shop where he can stock bales of shoes for future sale.  In the near future he would like to own more shoe shops.

loans.use: to stock children's school shoes as the new term is about to begin.

loans.name: Leatitia

texts.en:
Leatitia is 39 years old and married with two children ages five and seven years old.  Her business is well organized and she is well known in the field of selling Irish potatoes.   She works from 7am until 5pm every day except on Sunday.  She has three years of experience and she currently employs two people to help her. 

Leatitia has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to increase her business by buying large quantities of Irish potatoes.  With the profits, Laetitia will reinvest in her business and save for the future.  Leatitia also hopes to buy an office with her profits.

loans.use: to purchase large quantities of Irish potatoes to sell.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en: Daniel is a hardworking business man aged 38.  He is married and blessed with four children.  For the last two years, he has been managing a curio shop (store for tourists) to raise his family.  In the next five years, he wants to open several branches of his business.  He is requesting a loan of 30,000 Kenyan shillings to buy raw materials such as bones, paints, and animal skins to make curios.  Thanks to Faulu Kenya, he has been able to expand his business through his previous loans.

loans.use: to buy raw materials such as bones, paints, and animal skins to make curios.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more female, male, crape soled shoes.

loans.name: Mbalu

texts.en: Mbalu, aged 33, is an aggressive businessman. He is married and blessed with three children. For the last 3 years, he has been selling home banks (containers for saving money) to make a living. In the next 5 years, he wants to expand his business. He is requesting a loan of 30,000 Kenya shillings to buy materials for making the home banks (containers for saving money). Faulu Kenya has enabled him to become more business-oriented.

loans.use: To buy materials for making home banks (containers for saving money).

loans.name: Julienne

texts.fr:
Femme mariée, âgée de 52ans, mère de 4 enfants dont  l’âge varie entre 12 et 24 ans.
Elle a commencée à vendre de la friperie depuis 2008 avec un capital de 95000 frs.
Accueillante, ses prix sont abordables et elle est stricte dans le choix de ses ballots. Ses ventes journalières varient entre 30000f et 50000F, et quand elle tombe sur un  ballot de mauvaise qualité, elle procède aux soldes  pour récupérer son capital
Avec l’actuel prêt, elle va renforcer  son activité en achetant : 1ballot de sacs, des draps, 1 ballot des serviettes (fin de série), ½ ballot des nappes de table et torchons et ces ballots sont acheter selon la saison.
Très motivée, elle compte vendre beaucoup afin  d’épargner pour se préparer au prochain cycle.
Son objectif est d’avoir plus de moyens, acheter une parcelle, construire un boutique de vente de friperie.
Elle contribue à l’éducation morale et financière de sa famille en  leurs assurant  un bien être.
Son entourage l’apprécie et pense qu’elle se débrouille bien  car elle ouvre au moins 2 ballots par semaine.
texts.en:
This woman is 52 years old, married, and a mother to four children ranging in age from 12 to 24 years old. She started selling second-hand goods in 2008 with a capital of 95,000F. She is friendly, her prices are affordable, and she is very discriminating in her selection of merchandise. Her daily sales average 30,000 to 50,000F. Poor quality items, if any, are marked down to allow her to recoup her investment. 

She will use the current loan to strengthen her business by buying one bale of handbags, some bed sheets, one bale of discontinued towels, and half a bale of tablecloths and tea towels. These are seasonal purchases. 

Highly motivated, she plans to sell a lot in order to save and prepare for the next cycle. Her goal is to increase her income, buy a plot of land, and build a store to sell second-hand merchandise. 

She helps to support her family both morally and financially by ensuring their well-being. Those close to her appreciate her, and they believe that she is doing very well as she sells at least two bales per week.

loans.use: to buy bales of handbags, bedsheets, tablecloths, tea towels, etc.

loans.name: Hamisi

texts.en:
Hamisi is a married man with three children all of whom attend school. He owns a house that has electricity and piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past year, he has been operating a retail shop, selling to his neighbours and passersby. He faces a major problem due to delayed payments by debtors. He dreams of expanding his business to educate his children. 

With the KES 10,000, he wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, and tea leaves. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, and tea leaves.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph is 59 years old, married, with five children.  He does quarrying to earn a living.  He has employed five people in his business.  Additionally, he does poultry farming for more income generation.  Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has managed to improve his business.  He hopes to grow his business for more income generation.  His desire is to become the major supplier of stones and ballast in his region.  He needs a loan of 40, 000 Kenya shillings to pay for labor.

loans.use: To pay for labor

loans.name: Jean Bosco

texts.en:
Bosco is 43 years old. He is married with five children between 3 and 16 years old. He sells various goods such as rice, sugar, soap, lotions etc and he has five years of experience in this business. He works from 6 am until 8 pm every day except on Sunday.

Bosco has requested a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company to expand his business by purchasing more goods such as rice, sugar, soap, lotions etc to sell. Once his business is expanded, he hopes to reinvest in this business and to save in the future. He will also be able to pay school fees for his children and to renovate his house.
