loans.use: To purchase various goods such as rice, sugar, soap, lotions etc to sell

loans.name: Peter

texts.en: Peter is a determined businessman who is 29 years old. He is married and blessed with three children. For the last three years, he has been operating a retail shop to earn a living. In the next five years, he wants to buy a plot. He is requesting a loan of 30,000 Kenyan shillings to buy sweets, torches and biscuits. Thanks to Faulu Kenya, he has been able to expand his business through his previous loans.

loans.use: To buy sweets, torches and biscuits

loans.name: Tabu

texts.en:
Tabu is a single woman with one child who lives in a rental house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school. 

For the past two years, she has operated a retail shop business, selling in a shop to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of the high cost of transportation in her business. Tabu dreams of expanding her business to a wholesale shop in the future.

With the KSHS 70,000, she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, sugar, maize flour and detergents. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of wheat flour, sugar, maize flour and detergents.

loans.name: Kassim

texts.en:
Kassim is a married man with five children: three girls and two boys. He owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past year, he has operated a business selling clothes at the market to his neighbors. He faces a major challenge of seasonality in his business. He dreams of expanding her business and improve his living standards. 

With the KSHS 10,000, he wants to purchase bundles of Khangas, trousers and cloth materials. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of Khangas, trousers and cloth materials.

loans.name: Naleku

texts.en:
Naleku is 42 years old and married to Sopee. They have three children who are 24, 23, and 14 years old. She has been selling livestock for the last three years, making a monthly profit of KES 5,000. She has been loaned KES 30,000, which she plans to use to purchase more livestock to sell.

With the anticipated profit, she hopes to purchase a plot and build rental houses. In the near future, she hopes to start a ranch.

loans.use: to purchase livestock to sell

loans.name: Sofia

texts.en:
Sofia is a single woman with one child who attends school. She owns a house that has piped water but not electricity. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past six years, she has operated a retail shop business, selling in a shop to her neighbors and passersby. Her major challenge is theft because of the lack of security in her area of operation. She dreams of expanding her business in the future.

With the KSHS 25,000, she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour and sugar. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour and sugar.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a married man with four children, three of whom attend school while one is still too young for school. He owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

Ali has operated a vegetable stall business for over ten years, selling in a shop to his neighbours and passers-by. He faces a major challenge of price fluctuation of products in the market. 

He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business. With the Kshs 10,000 he wants to purchase sacks of tomatoes, potatoes, onions and green vegetables to sell.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of tomatoes, potatoes, onions and green vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Nelvy Brunel

texts.fr:
Cliente de 27 ans, marie et père d’un enfant de 3 ans. Quand il perd son père en classe de troisième, il arrête ses études par manque de moyens.
En 2002, il se lance dans la vente de la friperie. 
Sa stratégie est  d’acheter des ballots de fin de séries, des tenues a la mode ,  des pantalons et  culottes en jeans  qu’il trie et vend en détail au marche , ses ventes sont de 30.000 a 60.000 frs par jour et a l’intention de beaucoup épargner pour atteindre ses objectifs.
Avec l’expérience acquise, il a pour ambition d’ouvrir une boutique d’habits prêt a porter.
texts.en:
Nelvy Brunel, age 27, is married and the father of a three-year-old child. He lost his father when he was in 9th grade, and had to interrupt his studies due to a lack of financial means. In 2002, he started selling secondhand clothing. His strategy consists in buying bales of discontinued items, fashionable clothes, trousers and jeans, that he sorts and retails at the market.

His daily sales amount to XOF 30'000 to 60'000 (ca US$ 60 to 120) and he intends to save a lot to reach his goals. Thanks to experience he acquired, he intends to open a ready-to-wear store.

loans.use: to buy bales of secondhand clothing, jeans, skirts and trousers

loans.name: Jeanne

texts.en:
Jeanne is 45 years old and is married with six children aged between 4 and 25 years old. Her business is well-organized and is well known in the business of sewing sweaters. Her business hours are from 7am until 6pm every day except on Sunday. She has two years of experience. 

Jeanne has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to increase her business by buying new machines for her sewing. With any profits, she will reinvest in her business and save for her future. Jeanne hopes also to pay school fees for her children with her profits.

loans.use: To purchase new machines for her sewing business.

loans.name: Shughuli

texts.en:
Shuguli is a married man with four children, all of whom attend school. He owns a house that has no piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food and transport costs. 

Shuguli has operated a food stall business for the past twelve years, his potential customers are neighbours and passers-by. He faces a major challenge of theft because of insecurity in his place of operation. He dreams of expanding his business in the future.

With the Kshs 10,000 he wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, sugar, maize and cooking fat oil. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of wheat flour, sugar, maize and cooking fat oil.

loans.name: Fredrick

texts.en: Fredrick is a focused businessman who is 19 years old and single. For the last two years, he has been baking and supplying cakes and bread to make a living. He uses his motorbike to transport the cakes and bread to his customers. He also does dairy farming for more income. In the next five years, he wants to become the major supplier of cakes and bread in his region. He is requesting a loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings to buy wheat flour as an ingredient for baking cakes and bread.

loans.use: To buy wheat flour as an ingredient for baking

loans.name: Fredrick

texts.en:
Fredrick is a married man with three children. One of his children attends school while two are still young for school. He owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food and transport costs.

For the past three years, he has operated a retail shop business, selling to his neighbors and passersby. He faces a major challenge of seasonality in his business. He dreams of expanding his business in the future.

With the KSHS 40,000, he wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, sugar and cooking fat oil. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, sugar and cooking fat oil.

loans.name: Jaqueline De La Paz

texts.es:
Jaqueline, administra un chalet en la unidad de salud, tiene casa propia que la heredo de su madre, vive junto a ella una hermana y un hijo de 20 años de edad, el negocio inicio hace 11 años cuando su madre decidió instalarlo, el horario de atención es de 6:00am a 4:00pm.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para invertirlo en bebida (gaseosas y jugos), pan dulce, agua, chicharrón y quesillo para las pupusas, esta compra le ayudara para surtir el negocio y estar más preparada para atender la demanda.
El objetivo de Jaqueline es tener un negocio bien surtido, atender a los clientes de la mejor manera y apoyar a su hijo que actualmente está estudiando contaduría pública.
texts.en:
Jaqueline runs a snack bar in the health clinic. She has her own home, which she inherited from her mother. She lives with her mother, a sister, and her 20-year-old child. Jaqueline's mother decided to open the business eleven years ago. The store is open from 6:00 am to 4:00 pm.
Jaqueline is currently requesting a loan to invest in drinks (pop and juice), sweetbread, water, pork rinds and cheese for making pupusas [a thick corn tortilla stuffed with cheese, fried pork rind, chicken, or refried beans]. This purchase will help her to stock her business more and to be more prepared for her customers' demand.
Jaqueline's goal is to have a well-stocked business, to tend to her customers in the best possible manner, and to support her child who is currently studying public accounting.

loans.use: to purchase pop, juice, bread, water, and other items for her business.

loans.name: Gabriel

texts.en:
Gabriel is a married man with two children, both of whom attend school. He lives in a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past four years, he has operated a mobile phone accessories and charging business. His potential customers are neighboring community members. He faces a major challenge of the high cost of transportation in his business. Gabriel dreams of expanding his business and purchasing a piece of land in the future.

With the KSHS 40,000, he wants to purchase phone battery chargers for resale. He decided to join Yehu to access loans and improve his standard of living.

loans.use: To purchase phone battery chargers for resale.

loans.name: John

texts.en: John is a focused businessman who is 34 years old. He is married and blessed with two children. For the last five years, he has been managing a van (matatu) transport service to earn a living. He also runs a grocery store for more income. In the next five years, he wants to buy three vans. He is requesting a loan of 25,000 Kenyan shillings to service his van.

loans.use: To service his van

loans.name: Baby

texts.en:
Baby is 38 years old and married with four children between 3 and 23 years old. She runs an electronic appliance store in Waterloo near Freetown. She has three children who are currently attending school.

Baby has owned this business for two years and sells television sets, tapes and DVDs at her store. Her business is the only source of income she has. She says that the main challenge to her business is the problem of transportation.

She requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to purchases more electronic appliances. Baby says that the extra income from this loan will help her improve the standard of living for her family. In the future, she would like to be a supplier for other business partners.

loans.use: To purchases more television sets, DVDs and tapes.

loans.name: Tendwan

texts.en:
Tendwan is 37 years old. He is married and the father of five children. He has been a mixed farmer for the last 11 years.  

He learned about KADET LTD from the KADET staff during their marketing. This will be his first loan and he is planning to buy more sheep and farm inputs. The business has proven to be doing well in the area due to conducive climactic conditions. 

With the profits he hopes to make from the proceeds of this loan, he plans to expand the business. His hope and dream is to become a prominent businessman in livestock and buy a bigger piece of land.

loans.use: to buy more sheep and farm inputs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy farm inputs

loans.name: Biasha

texts.en:
Biasha is a married woman with two children, one of whom attends school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family. 

For the past three years, she has operated a maize selling business, selling at the market to her neighbours and passers-by. She faces a major challenge of high cost of transportation in her business. She dreams of expanding her business in the future.

With the Kshs 40,000 she wants to purchase sacks of maize for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of maize for resale.

loans.name: Mwanajuma

texts.en:
Mwanajuma is a married woman with five children, all of whom graduated from school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

For the past ten years, she has operated a cereals selling business, selling at the market to her neighbours and passers-by. She faces a major challenge of high cost of transportation in her business. She dreams of expanding her business in the future.

With the Kshs 40,000 she wants to purchase bundles of maize and rice for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of maize and rice for resale.

loans.name: Padppa Dedokpo Group

texts.fr: Le groupe PADPPA DEDOKPO est composé de quatre personnes qui habitent la même maison au Bénin. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Oumè Séraphine est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo.Oumè Séraphine est âgée de 52 ans et vit au Bénin. Oumè Séraphine est mariée à un pêcheur du nom de José. Le couple a quatre enfants, qui sont encore tous à leur charge. Certains des enfants sont scolarisés. Oumè Séraphine n’a jamais été à l’école. Pour subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants, Oumè Séraphine vend depuis quarante ans des boissons non alcoolisées et de l'"Akassa", une pâte préparée sur la base de l'amidon de maïs. Oumè Séraphine s’approvisionne  dans l'un des marchés du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Oumè Séraphine sollicite, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe PADPPA DEDOKPO, un quatrième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les crédits reçus antérieurement ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
PADPPA DEDOKPO group comprises four persons, who live in the same house in Benin. The group leader, named Oumè Séraphine, is the one raising her hand in the photograph. She's 52 years old and married to a fisherman named José. The couple has four children, whom they still have to support. Some of them attend school.

Oumè Séraphine never went to school. To provide for herself and her children, she's been selling non-alcoholic beverages and "Akassa" (a paste made out of corn starch) for forty years. She gets her supplies in one of Benin's market.

In order to meet customer demand and increase her revenue and income, Oumè Séraphine, together with the other members of the group PADPPA DEDOKPO, is seeking a loan from Kiva's partner, ALIDé. The previous loans were repaid without problems.

loans.use: to buy non-alcoholic beverages and corn

loans.name: Ella Flore Charby

texts.fr:
Cliente  âgé de  39 ans, divorcé et mère de trois (3) enfants dont l’âge varie entre 21 ans et  06 ans. N’ayant pas de soutient pour poursuivre ses universitaires, elle se lance dans le commerce en détail des produits alimentaires depuis 6 ans.
Ses ventes sont considérables ; elle encaisse en moyenne 30 000 à 80 000 F par jour. A l’octroie de se prêt ; elle va renforcer le stock de sa marchandise en achetant 40 sacs à main.
Avec un bon accueil des clients, la cliente à une bonne réputation dans le marché ; elle s’approvisionne auprès des autres fournisseurs de la place
 Avec les bénéfices de ses ventes, elle pense épargner et à la longue pour  ouvrir une boutique d’habillement. Comme une bonne mère de famille, elle pense acheté un terrain et y construire.
texts.en:
Ella Flore Charby, age 39, is divorced and the mother of three children, aged 6 to 21. Lacking support to pursue her university studies, she started retailing food products six years ago. Her sales are very high : on average, she collects XOF 30'000 to 80'000 (ca US$ 60 to 160) every day.

She will use her loan to bolster her stock by buying 40 handbags. She takes good care of her customers and has a good reputation at the market. She gets her supplies from other providers in the city. With her profits, she wants to put money away to in the end open a clothing store. She's a good mother and she's thinking about purchasing a lot to build a house.

loans.use: to buy all sorts of handbags

loans.name: Maria Yolanda

texts.es:
María, vive con dos hijos de 18 y 5 años de edad, ella se dedica a una pupuseria y administrar una tienda de productos domésticos, lo atiende de 7:00am a 8:00pm, tiene 2 años de existir y surgió por iniciativa propia.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para la compra de aceite, azúcar, churros, gaseosa, frijoles y arroz, con esta compra tendrá más capacidad para atender la clientela y satisfacer las necesidades de ellos.
El sueño de María es mejorar la condición económica de su familia y crecer con el negocio.
texts.en:
María lives with her two children ages 18 and 5. She has a pupusa business [pupusa: a thick corn tortilla stuffed with cheese, fried pork rind, chicken, or refried beans] and also runs a convenience store. She tends to her store from 7:00 am to 8:00 pm. She started this business on her own initiative and has had it for two years.
She is now requesting a loan for the purchase of oil, sugar, churros, pop, beans and rice. With this purchase she will have a greater capacity for serving her customers and satisfying their needs. 
Maria's dream is to improve her family's economic situation and to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase oil, sugar, churros, pop, beans and rice

loans.name: Padppa Ste Cecile Group

texts.fr: Le groupe PADPPA STE CECILE est composé de trois personnes qui habitent la même maison au Bénin. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Justine est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Justine est âgée de 49 ans et vit au Bénin .Justine est une veuve qui a quatre enfants, dont deux restent encore à sa charge. Certains des enfants sont scolarisés. Justine n’a jamais été à l’école. Pour subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants, Justine vend depuis vingt ans du poisson frais. Justine s’approvisionne au bord des lac du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenau, Justine sollicite, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe PADPPA STE CECILE un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les deux premiers crédits ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
PADPPA STE CECILE group is made up of three persons who live in the same house in Benin. The group leader, named Justine, is the one raising her hand in the photograph. She's 49 years old and lives in Benin. She's a widow with four children, out of whom she still has to support two. Some of the children attend school.

Justine never went to school. To provide for herself and for her children, she's been selling fresh fish for 20 years. She gets her supplies on the banks of Benin's lakes. In order to meet customer demand and increase her revenue and income, she's seeking a third loan from Kiva's parter, ALIDé, together with the other members of PADPPA STE CECILE  group. The first two loans were repaid without problems.

loans.use: to buy fresh fish

loans.name: Teresa De Jesus

texts.es:
Teresa, vive con sus tres hijos, se dedica a la venta de semilla de marañón, ropa y cosméticos, inicio con el negocio hace varios años, trabaja de forma ambulante, no tiene un horario fijo y ha ganado clientes con su experiencia.
Actualmente necesita invertir un préstamo en ropa y semilla de marañón, con esta mercadería lograra satisfacer la demanda de los clientes, y aumentar la mercadería creciendo con el negocio.
La aspiración de ella es que su negocio crezca y lograr el establecimiento de un local de venta, apoyar a sus hijos y mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Teresa lives with her three children. She sells marañón seeds, clothes and cosmetics. She started the business several years ago and works as a street vendor. She has no set schedule and has gained customers with her experience.

At present, she needs to invest a loan in clothes and marañón seeds. With this merchandise, she will be able to satisfy her customers' demands and increase her merchandise, growing her business.  

She aspires to growing her business and opening up a store, supporting her children and improving their quality of life.

loans.use: to buy marañon seeds to sell.

loans.name: Vilma Guadalupe

texts.es:
Vilma, es madre soltera de dos hijos de 16 y 5 años de edad, ella vive en compañía de su madre y hermanos, se dedica a la venta de tortillas en el mercado municipal, el negocio inicio hace 10 años por medio de su madre, labora de lunes a domingo.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para la compra de maíz, leña y cal, estos materiales son los necesarios para la elaboración de las tortillas, este préstamo le ayudara para que su negocio este más estable y también que sus ventas sean mejores.
La aspiración de Vilma es incrementar el negocio, que sus ganancias sean mejores para ayudar a sus hijos con los gastos de educación.
texts.en:
Vilma is a single mother of two children, aged 16 and 5. She llives with her mother and siblings. She sells tortillas in the city market, a business she started 10 years ago through her mother. She works Monday through Sunday.

At present, she is asking for a loan to buy corn, firewood and lime. These materials are necessary to make tortillas. The loan will help her make her business stable and will also improve her sales.

Vilma's goal is to grow her business, improve her earnings and help her children with education expenses.

loans.use: to buy corn, firewood and lime.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy corn and propane gas, in order to make tortillas.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase cloth materials for his tailoring business.

loans.name: Francois Herve

texts.fr:
Client âgé de 36 ans, célibataire et père d’un enfant âgé de 11 ans.
N’ayant pas de motivation pour poursuivre ses études universitaire, il se lance dans le commerce des cartes de recharges et des appels téléphoniques  depuis 2007.
Ses ventes journalières sont considérables , il vend en moyenne 50 000 – 75 000 F FCA par jour. Avec ce crédit  il va renforcer son commerce en achetant : des cartes recharges et du recharge électronique des réseaux nationaux comme : MTN, AIRTEL, WARID, AZUR.
Avec les bénéfices de son activité ; il compte épargner et à la longue ouvrir un autre point de vente où il pourra vendre du crédit de recharge en gros afin de fournir à d’autres commerçants de la place.
Comme un bon père de famille , il voudrait construire une maison  et financer les études de son enfant.
texts.en:
This client is 36 years old, single and the father of an 11 year old child. With no motivation to continue his university studies, he began selling reload and phone cards in 2007. His daily sales figures are quite high: on average he sells 50,000 - 70,000 CFA francs per day. 

With the loan, he will expand his business by buying: reload cards and electronic reloads on national networks like MTN, AIRTEL, WARID, AZUR. With the profit, he plans to save and, in the long term, open another sales outlet where he can sell reload credits at wholesale so that he can be a supplier to other local sellers. As a good father, he wants to build a house and pay for his child's schooling.

loans.use: to buy Airtel, MTN, Azur, and Warid pre-paid phone cards.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase four calves

loans.name: Elisha

texts.en:
Elisha is a married man with two school-going children. He owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food and electricity bills.

For the past 11 years, he has operated a retail shop business selling to his neighboring community. He faces a major challenge of the high cost of transportation in his business. Elisha dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the KSHS 20,000, he wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, sugar and detergents. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, sugar and detergents.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more timber.

loans.name: Wise Woman Group

texts.en:
This is 43-year-old Shedra from Masvingo. She is married and has four children, one attending school.  

Shedra buys and sells clothing, household appliances and maize. She has been doing this business for 13 years. Her main challenge is inadequate funding to meet the increasing orders she has. 

Shedra has requested a loan of $400 to buy TVs, radios and maize for sale. She says the extra income she will get will be used to improve her family's standard of living. 

In the future, Shedra plans to buy a commuter omnibus.

loans.use: To buy appliances and maize for sale.

loans.name: Kenga

texts.en:
Kenga is a married man with seven children, all of whom attend school. He owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

For the past year, he has operated a retail shop business, selling to his neighbors and passersby. Kenga faces a major challenge of the high cost of transporting goods to his place of operation. He dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the KSHS 20,000, he wants to purchase more stock of wheat flour, maize flour and sugar. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: To purchase wheat flour, maize flour and sugar.

loans.name: Uhuru

texts.en:
Uhuru is a married man with three children, all of whom attend school. He owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past 10 years, he has operated a farming business, selling farm produce at the market and from home to his neighbors and passersby. He faces a major challenge of theft in his business. He dreams of establishing a larger farm in the future.

With the KSHS 20,000, he wants to purchase maize seeds and manure for planting. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: To purchase maize seeds and manure for planting.

loans.name: César Augusto

texts.es: César de 30 años vive en la ciudadela 20 de Julio al sur de la ciudad, es un hombre casado muy estudioso y poliglota, pues además  de Español, su idioma, habla inglés, francés, alemán,  estudia lenguas modernas en la Universidad  y es un gran comerciante, que se dedica a esta actividad, vendiendo productos de salsamentaría, desechables, queso y carnes frías en un punto de venta ubicado en la casa de sus padres, lugar donde vive. Cesar es un joven de muchas ideas emprendedoras, su experiencia data  del legado de su padre empresario de la panadería y  también cuando  fue niño tenía un negocio como su pasatiempo  preferido, donde sus compañeros jugaban nintendo y él ganaba dinero.  Antes de emprender su salsamentaría,  la clientela de su padre ya había solicitado este servicio; él  observó el mercado y decidió quien sería su clientela y con la expectativa de crecimiento , siempre está pendiente de los productos que se requieren para venderlo; sus principales compradores  son los propietarios de negocios de comidas rápidas, ubicados en el sector más comercial de comidas de la ciudadela 20 de Julio y en  los alrededores del Estadio Metropolitano, escenario del balompié  profesional,  llamado también la casa del Junior de Barranquilla, equipo  de futbol, amado por los costeños, cerca al cual están ubicados grandes superficies  y se mueve el comercio formal e informal en general. Las ventas de su negocio son diarias, en su potencial proceso de lograr nuevos clientes está pendiente de vincular a su mercado restaurantes y negocios ambulantes de alimentos. Sus ventas son el 40% de contado y 60 as crédito con recuperación semanal. Para sostener fiel a su clientela aplica su gran vocación de servicio y está dispuesto siempre a obedecer a su clientela, la visita, recompensa, establece relaciones amistosas, en fin aplica técnicas de mercadeo relacional.  Su credikiva es el primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con él comprará al por mayor  y de contado salsas, carnes frías, que le dan un mayor margen de rentabilidad para poder cubrir costos y gastos en que incurra el negocio. Su sueño y gran propósito es terminar su carrera profesional y fortalecer su negocio hasta lograr una gran empresa.
texts.en:
César, 30, lives in the 20 de Julio neighborhood in the south of the city.  He’s a married, very studious polyglot because besides Spanish, his language, he also speaks English, French and German and is studying modern languages at university.  He’s also a great merchant selling cured meats, disposable items, cheese and cold cuts at a sales point located in his parents’ house.  César is a young man with many entrepreneurial ideas.  His experience dates from his father’s legacy: a bakery.  When César was a little boy he had his own business: his friends would play Nintendo and he earned money this way.

Prior to opening his delicatessen his father’s customers had already requested this type of service.  He observed the market and decided who his customers would be and provide growth expectation.  He’s always on the lookout for products needed for sales.  His main customers are owners of fast food businesses located in the 20 de Julio neighborhood’s most commercial food selling sector and also around the Metropolitan Studio, scene of professional soccer games, also known as the home of the Barranquilla “Juniors” team, a team loved by residents of the coastal zone.  Near it a vast expanses and formal and informal commerce takes place there.  His sales are daily and he has constant potential of adding new customers tied to the restaurant industry and street food vendors.

His sales are 40% cash and 60% credit with weekly repayment lags.  To keep his customers he applies his great service vocation and is always willing to obey his customers.  Their visits and rewards establish friendly relations.  In all, he applies relational marketing techniques.

His Kiva loan is the first financing he gets from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  He will use it to pay cash for wholesale purchases of sauces and cold cuts thereby qualifying for discounts that translate to higher profits to cover costs and expenses he incurs in business.   His dream and great goal is to complete his professional career and continue to strengthen his business until it becomes a great firm.

loans.use: to pay cash for wholesale purchases of cold cuts and cured meats.

loans.name: Bethy Hornela

texts.fr:
Cliente  mariée âgé de  22 ans, n’ayant pas de soutien pour poursuivre ses études supérieurs, elle ouvre un dépôt et  se lance dans la vente des légumes, oignons, échalotes, tomates fraiches, céleri et persil..
Elle vend chaque jour de très bon matin , elle encaisse en moyenne 10 000 à 17 000 F par jour.
A l’octroie de se prêt , elle va renforcer le stock de sa marchandise en achetant 1 filet d’oignon jaune , des tomates fruits  échalote, un carton de boite de tomate, carton de cube jumbo et magie, de la  ciboule en gros. 
Avec un bon accueil des clients, elle a une bonne réputation dans le marché . 
Avec les bénéfices de ses ventes, elle pense épargner et à la longue devenir grossiste en vue de fournir les denrées aux  autres vendeurs de la place. Comme une bonne mère de famille, elle pense acheter un terrain pour ses enfants.
texts.en:
This customer is married and twenty-two years old. Lacking financial support to pursue higher education, she opened a warehouse and started selling vegetables, onions, shallots, fresh tomatoes, celery and parseley.
She starts selling very early every day, collecting an average of 10,000 to 17,000 XAF daily. When this loan is granted, she will increase her stock of merchandise by purchasing from a wholesaler one mesh bag of yellow onions, fresh tomatoes, shallots, one box of canned tomatoes, one box of Maggi and Jumbo stock cubes, and chives.
Being welcoming to her customers, she has a good reputation on the marketplace.
With the profit from her sales, she is planning on saving and in the long run wants to become a wholesaler in order to provide merchandise to the other  sellers on the marketplace. As a good mother, she is thinking about purchasing a plot of land for her children.

loans.use: to buy fresh tomatoes, red onions, shallots, chives, celery and parsley

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to add more items to his grocery store.

loans.name: Katana

texts.en:
Katana is a single man who owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is business rent bills.

For the past year, he has operated a retail shop business, selling in a shop and from home to his neighbors and passersby. He faces a major challenge of the high cost of transportation in his business. Katana dreams of expanding his business to a wholesale one in the future.

With the KSHS 15,000, he wants to purchase household consumptions, bundles of maize four, wheat flour, cooking fat oil and sugar. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of maize flour, wheat flour, cooking fat oil and sugar.

loans.name: Alex

texts.en:
Alex is a married man with three school-going children. He owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past year, he has operated a carpentry business, making tables, chairs and beds for sale in a shop to his neighbors and passersby. His major challenge is the high cost of transportation in his business. Alex dreams of establishing another business in the future.

With the KSHS 10,000, he wants to purchase more equipment for the carpentry business. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: To purchase more equipment for his carpentry business.

loans.name: Kanze

texts.en:
Kanze is a married woman with five children, all of whom graduated from school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past four years she has operated a retail shop business, selling to her neighbours and passers-by. She faces a major challenge of high cost of transportation in her business. Kanze dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future. 

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase bundles of maize flour and wheat flour for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of maize flour and wheat flour for resale.

loans.name: Harriet

texts.en:
Harrient is a resident of Nkubu, Central Kenya. She is aged 43 and married with 2 children. She has been in farming for 9 years producing and selling milk, bananas, beans and eggs which all go to the local market.

Harriet has requested a loan of 30,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase poultry birds for her farm. She says the income will help her in educating her two children and boost her cereals shop in the local market.

She mentions drought and diseases as the challenges in farming.

loans.use: To purchase poultry birds

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy bricks, doors, iron gates, and windows

loans.name: Teresa Nelli

texts.es: Teresa Nelli tiene 56 años, la señora Teresa se dedica a la venta de mercadería general, principalmente ropa, cosméticos, bolsos y calzado. Hace más de 5 años que se dedica a este negocio, en ese tiempo empezó con un capital pequeño y fue ahorrando poco a poco hasta lograr tener suficiente clientela. El crédito será invertido en la compra de cobertores, sabanas, pantalones, camisas, faldas, trajes, sandalias. Su meta es llegar a tener una tienda variada que pueda ser atendida por los miembros de su familia.
texts.en: Teresa Nelli is 56 years old. Señora Teresa sells different types of merchandise, primarily clothes, cosmetics, handbags and footwear. She has had the business for more than 5 years. When she started she had a small amount of capital but she saved little by little until she had enough customers.The loan will be invested in the purchase of blankets, sheets, trousers, shirts, skirts, dresses and sandals. Her goal is to have a store with a variety of products that members of her family can work in .

loans.use: to buy blankets, sheets, trousers, shirts, skirts, dresses and sandals.

loans.name: Elda Mariana

texts.es: La Señora Elda Mariana se dedica a la venta de mercadería en general. Tiene más de 9 años en este negocio.  su negocio consiste en ofrecer una gran variedad de productos a sus clientes, sus compras las realiza en Managua en donde obtiene sus productos mucho más favorables,  es una mujer muy trabajadora y que se preocupa por el bienestar de su familia, sobresale por ser una buena madre. El crédito lo utilizara para la compra de mercadería como pantalones, bolsos, toallas, sandalias, sabanas, cosméticos y ropa en general. Las ganancias las necesita para cubrir con los gastos del hogar.
texts.en: Elda Mariana sells general merchandise. She has had this business for more than 9 years. Her business consists of offering a wide variety of products to her customers. She makes her purchases in Managua, where she gets much better products. She is a very hardworking woman who is concerned with her family's wellbeing and she is an excellent mother. She will use the loan to buy merchandise such as pants, bags, towels, sandals, sheets, cosmetics and clothing in general. She needs the income to cover her household expenses.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as pants, bags, towels, sandals, cosmetics and clothing in general.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy medicine and pay for doctor visits for her little girl.

loans.name: Vecinas De San Pablo Group

texts.es: El grupo se llama "VECINAS D. SAN PABLO" y se ubica en el Estado D. México. este municipio se distingue por sus bellos manantiales y grandes campos verdes, por sus fiestas del pueblo, su gente trabajadora, emprendedora y L. humildad que en cada uno D. sus habitantes existe. El grupo esta conformado por diez integrantes. L. señora Alicia es L. presidenta del grupo. ElL. inició su negocio hace 6 años, el cual consiste en L. venta D. dulces y juguetes afuera D. las escuelas, requiere el prestamo para comprar más dulces y juguetes ya que los niños le piden más variedad y si compra en cantidades grandes su precio es más economico. ElL. tiene 38 años, estudió hasta L. secundaria, es ser una persona emprendedora con muchas ganas D. trabajar, siempre con el deseo D. brindarle lo mejor a su familia cada dia, vive en union libre, tiene una D. hijas D. 14 años D. edad y su mayor sueño es ver a su hija graduada y con una mejor calidad D. vida que elL. no pudo tener.
texts.en: The group is called "VECINAS D. SAN PABLO" and it is located in the state of Mexico. This town is known for its beautiful spring waters and extensive green fields, for its town festivals, its hardworking, enterprising and humble people. The group consists of 10 members. Señora Alicia is the president of the group. She started her business 6 years ago. She sells sweets and toys outsiD. schools. She is asking for the loan to buy more sweets and toys as the children are asking her for a greater variety. Also if she buys in large quantities the price is more economical. She is 38 years old and studied until high school. She is an enterprising person, very eager to work whose wish is to always proviD. the best for her family every day. She is in a common-law marriage and has a daughter who is 14 years old. Her biggest dream is to see her daughter graduate and have a better quality of life than she did.

loans.use: to buy sweets and toys.

loans.name: Dinora

texts.en:
Dinora is one of our individual loan borrowers. She operates a cosmetic and beauty products stall. Dinora’s family consists of her four children and husband, but just three of her children live with her and their father. She said that her most difficult challenge is taking care of her family by paying attention to their needs, helping her husband to produce income, and also help him to rebuild their house.

Dinora is one of our businesswomen. Before she ran this business, 4 years ago, she saved for a little while untill she had a sufficient amount to start her sales. As soon as she started, she requested a loan in her community group because she needed capital to invest. After 3 years having group loans, she decided to be an individual and start taking bigger loans. She sells cosmetic and beauty products, and she is planning to invest this loan to increase her inventory. 

One of Dinora's dreams is to travel to Spain. She will be using her profits toward reinvesting in her business. She thanks all of you for your support!

loans.use: to purchase cosmetic and beauty products to sell.

loans.name: Henry

texts.en:
Henry is a father of 6, all adults. He is aged 62 and has been in farming in Nkubu area, Central Kenya for 30 years, producing and selling milk and bananas to the local market.

Henry has requested a loan of 30,000 KES from Juhidi Kilimo to construct a grazing unit for his dairy cows. He says the unit will protect his cows and ensure his milk yield is improved. This, he adds, will improve his families living standards.

He says animal diseases is the greatest challenge.

loans.use: To construct a grazing unit for his dairy cows

loans.name: Rosa Escarleth

texts.es: Rosa tiene su negocio que es la venta de cosméticos. Desde hace 3 años se dedica a este medio de vida. Su mayor desafío ha sido buscar a las personas a quienes les vendió productos y no le han pagado. Tiene 3 hijos menores de edad a su cargo, que con mucho sacrificio les ha brindado estudio, alimento y vestimenta. Es por eso que solicita este crédito para la compra de lápiz labial, pintura de uñas, pintura de labios, cremas, tratamientos, entre otros.
texts.en:
Rosa has her business, which is the sale of cosmetics. She has made a living this way for 3 years. Her greatest challenge has been to find those people to whom she has sold products who have not yet paid for them. 

Rosa has three young children who are dependent on her and for whom, at great sacrifice, she has provided an education, food and clothing. Consequently she is requesting this loan to buy lip pencils, nail polish, lipstick, creams and beauty treatments, among other items.

loans.use: to buy lip pencils, nailpolish, lipstick, creams, beauty treatments, among other items.

loans.name: Harlan Francisco

texts.es:
El joven Harlan Francisco es un joven soltero originario del municipio de El Sauce, se desempeña como Administrador en una Institución de la localidad donde tiene muchos años de laborar.
Es el segundo crédito que solicita en Ceprodel para cancelar la compra de un electrodoméstico que adquirió al crédito, ya que no le resulta pagar el doble de lo que vale, es por esta razón que solicitó este crédito para cumplir con su objetivo.
texts.en:
Harlan is a young single man from the town of El Sauce. He has worked as the administrator in a local institution for many years. This is the second loan that he has asked for through Ceprodel.

He is asking for this loan because he would like to pay off a debt he incurred buying an electrical household appliance, because he is paying back twice the amount of the value of the appliance. This is the reason that he is asking for this loan, in order to carry out this objective.

loans.use: to cancel the debt incurred buying an electrical household appliance at high interest rate

loans.name: Ayidekon 1 Group

texts.fr: Le groupe AYIDEKON 1 est formé de sept personnes qui habitent toutes dans le même quartier au Bénin. La représentante de ce groupe, nommée Rosaline est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo. C’est la quatrième fois que ce groupe sollicite l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue d’élever le niveau de leur activité. Rosaline est mariée à un cultivateur du nom de Michel. Le couple a quatre enfants, tous scolarisés et vivant à leur charge. Rosaline vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges familiales. Il y a près de vingt cinq ans que Rosaline produit de la farine de manioc (fait à base de tubercules de manioc), qu'elle vend de façon ambulante et par livraison au Bénin. En plus de cette activité, Rosaline vend des galettes. Rosaline s'approvisionne au Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer son activité et de mieux répondre à la demande de sa clientèle, Rosaline désire obtenir un quatrième financement, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe AYIDEKON 1.
texts.en:
The AYIDEKON 1 group is made up of seven persons who all live in the same neighborhood in Bénin. The representative of the group, Rosaline, is raising her h and in the photo. It is the fourth time that this group is asking for a loan from ALIDé in order to expand their businesses. 

Rosaline is married to a farmer named Michel. The couple has four children, all enrolled in school and living under their parents' roof. Rosaline lives with her children and her husband. They share in supporting their family. For almost 25 years, Rosaline has been producing manioc flour (made out of manioc tubers) which she sells going door to door and through delivery in  Bénin. Besides this business, Rosaline sells cookies. She buys her supplies in Bénin. 

Wishing to bolster her business and better respond to the needs of her clientele, Rosaline wants to receive a fourth loan, together with the other members of the AYIDEKON 1 group.

loans.use: to buy manioc tubers.

loans.name: Hilda Ceferina

texts.es: Hilda Ceferina se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras. Esta no es la primera vez que realiza financiamientos pues las experiencias que ha obtenido han sido gratificantes. Desde hace más de 22 años que tiene esta actividad, las ganas de sacar adelante a su familia son lo que motiva a Hilda a seguir trabajando fuertemente como lo realiza todos los días. Este crédito es con el objetivo de comprar melones, mangos, sandias, repollo, cebolla, papa, entre otros.
texts.en: Hilda Cerefina sells fruits and vegetables. This is not first time she has a requested loan. Therefore, the experiences she had have been rewarding. For more than 22 years, Hilda has been a vendor. She wishes to help her family get ahead. This is her motive for continuing to work hard every day. This loan will be used to purchase melons, watermelons, cabbage, onions, potatoes and other fruits and vegetables.

loans.use: buy melons, mangoes, watermelons, cabbages, onions, potaoes and other fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Alma Iris

texts.es:
La Sra. Alma Iris es originaria del municipio de El Sauce, se desempeña como maestra de educación  primaria en un colegio de dicho municipio con muchos años de experiencia.
Es el primer crédito que solicita en Ceprodel con el objetivo de adquirir una refrigeradora ya que es de necesidad en su hogar para refrigerar su comida e insumos, es por esta razón que solicitó dicho crédito para llevar a cabo su objetivo.
texts.en:
Alma Iris is from the town of El Sauce.  She works as an elementary school teacher in a school in the town and has many years experience.

This is the first loan that Alma Iris has requested from Ceprodel and her aim is to acquire a refrigerator as she needs one in her home to refrigerate her food and supplies.  She has requested this loan so that she can achieve her aim.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator

loans.name: Omar Isidro

texts.es: Omar Isidro tiene 38 años, su actividad es ofrecer los servicios de albañilería. Desde hace más de 15 años que tiene este medio de vida. El aprendió por su papa quien le enseño este negocio para que Omar pudiera salir adelante en la vida por medio de su esfuerzo y dedicación. El crédito que actualmente solicita es para la compra de herramientas como pala, cemento, hierro, bloques, ladrillos entre otros productos de construcción.
texts.en: Omar Isidro is 38 and he works offering his services as a bricklayer. He has had this livelihood for 15 years. He learned from his father, who taught him the trade so he would be able to get ahead in life through his own effort and dedication. The loan he is currently requesting is to buy a shovel, cement, iron, blocks and bricks among other construction items.

loans.use: to buy tools of the trade such as a shovel, cement, iron, blocks and bricks.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay university expenses

loans.name: Modoukpe

texts.fr:
Modoukpe est une femme âgé(e) de 27 ans. Elle est mariée å un soudeur. Elle a 01 enfant. 
Modoukpe travaille comme revendeuse de produits cosmétiques depuis 2006. Elle sert ses clients dans un marché de la place après avoir acheté au grand Marché de Lomé.
Modoukpe a requis son  premier cycle de prêt à WAGES afin d’acheter des produits cosmétiques.
texts.en:
Modoukpe is a 27-year-old woman married to a welder. She has one child. 

Modoukpe has been a small-scale retailer selling cosmetics since 2006. She serves her customers in a local marketplace after having bought her merchandise at the Grand Market in Lomé.

Modoukpe has requested her first loan from WAGES in order to buy cosmetics.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy pigs.

loans.name: Kattia

texts.es: Katia, tiene la edad 26 de años, está en unión libre, vive con su esposa y su hijo que es su mayor prioridad. Ella con el crédito va comprar unos terneros para el engorde. Ella lo que quiere es poder aumentar el número de animales a su poder. Ella quiere comprarlos pequeños para engordarlos y luego venderlos al mercado local. Ella quiere sacar el máximo de ganancias de este proyecto para ayudarle a su esposo con las obligaciones del hogar y tener ingresos extras y mejorar su bienestar familiar. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Ella no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Katia is 26, in a common-law relationship, and lives with her husband and her son, who is her greatest priority.  She is going to use the loan to buy calves for fattening. 

What she wants is to be able to increase the number of animals she owns. She wants to buy them small to fatten them, and then sell them at the local market. She wants to earn the maximum profit from this project, in order to help her husband with the household expenses, have extra income, and improve the well-being of her family. 

This is the first loan she has received from FUDECOSUR. She hasn't had other loans before from regular banks, but FUDECOSUR has offered her a loan with better terms; and the interest rate is much lower.

loans.use: To buy calves.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a washing machine

loans.name: Las Alegres De San Vi Group

texts.es: Este grupo se llama "LAS ALEGRES DE SAN VI" y se ubica en el Estado de México. Este municipio se distingue por las bellas fiestas del pueblo, su gente trabajadora y emprendedora. El grupo esta conformado por ocho integrantes. La señora Adriana es la presidenta del grupo. Ella inició su negocio hace 16 años, el cual consiste en un taller de costura, requiere el prestamo para comprar materia prima como telas, hilos y agujas; varias de sus clientas son madres y quieren que la señora Adriana les fabrique los uniformes para este nuevo ciclo escolar para sus hijos ya que son de mejor calidad y precio. Tiene 39 años, estudió hasta la secundaria, ella se distingue por ser una persona con muchas ganas de trabajar, siempre con el deseo de brindarle lo mejor a su familia, vive felizmente casada con sus hijos de 20, 19, 14, 7 años de edad.
texts.en:
The " Las Alegres de San Vi"  group is located in the State of Mexico.  This municipality is known for its beautiful town festivals, and for its hard-working, enterprising people. The group has 8 members. 

Adriana is the president of the group. She began her business, a dress-making workshop, 16 years ago. She needs the loan to buy raw material such as fabric, thread, and needles.  

Several of her customers are mothers and want Adriana to make their children's uniforms for the new school year, since they are better in quality and price.

She is 39, and has a high school education. She is known as a person who is very eager to work, always wanting to provide the best for her family.  She is happily married, and has children ages 20, 19, 14, and 7.

loans.use: To buy raw material such as fabric, thread and needles.

loans.name: Alfredo

texts.es: Alfredo, tiene la edad 56 de años, está casado  y vive con su esposa y 2 hijos que son su mayor prioridad. El con el crédito va comprar los insumos para asistir su cultivo de papa. El cuenta con un terreno apto ya sembrado del cultivo y quiere asistirlo para sacarle el mayor provecho de cosecha este año. El vende su producción al mercado local y quiere poder generar los ingresos necesarios para así poder salir adelante con su proyecto de papa. También quiere darle a su familia una buena calidad de vida en el futuro y cumplir planes a futuro. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El  no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja
texts.en: Alfredo is 55 years old, married, and lives with his wife and 2 children who are his greatest priority.  He will use the loan to buy fertilizer for his potato crop.  He has a good plot of land where he has already planted his crops and wants to get the most out of his harvest this year.  He sells his produce at the local market and wants to earn enough money to be able to help improve his potato farming.  He also wants to provide his family with a good quality of life in the future and fulfill his plans for the future.  This is the first loan he has received from FUDECOSUR.  He had not previously had any loans with state banks, but FUDECOSUR has provided him with a convenient loan and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: plant potatoes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy bricks and pay labor costs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy pigs and pig food

loans.name: Juan

texts.es: Juan, tiene la edad 48 de años, está casado y vive con su esposa y 3 hijos actualmente. El lo que va comprar es los materiales para una mejora a las porquerizas donde tiene sus cerdos. El cuneta con varios cerditos a su poder  y los quiere engordar para sacarle el mayor provecho. El con este mejora lo que pretende es poder tener mayor campo para d aumentar el número de cerdos y así poder aumentar las ganancias a la hora de la venta. El quiere darle a sus familia una mejor calidad  de vida y aumentar las ganancias para cada día mejorar su bienestar familiar. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El  no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en: Juan is 48 years old, married, and lives with his wife and three children.  He will use the loan to buy materials to improve his pigsties.  He has many little pigs and wants to fatten them up to get the most money he can.  He wants to increase the number of pigs he has and also increase earnings when it comes time to sell.  He wants to provide his family with a better quality of live and increase his earnings to improve his family's well-being each day.  This is the first loan he has received from FUDECOSUR.  He has not had any loans from other institutions, but FUDECOSUR has provided him with a convenient loan with a low interest rate.

loans.use: improve the infrastructure of his pigsties

loans.name: Martha Rosa

texts.es: Martha Rosa tiene 60 años, su actividad es una panadería. Desde hace más de 8 años que tiene su negocio. Pues siempre le ha gustado ser una persona luchadora  y que disfruta de brindarle a su familia los ingresos. Es por eso que le solicita este crédito con el fin de comprar productos como harina, huevos, mantequilla, queso, leche, entre otros. Sueña con hacer más grande su local en donde pueda tener más espacio para realizar sus productos.
texts.en:
Martha Rosa is 60, and owns a bakery. She has had her business for 8 years. 

She has always liked being a determined person who enjoys providing income for her family. That's why she is applying for this loan, in order to buy flour, eggs, butter, cheese, milk, and other things. 

She dreams about expanding her premises, so that she can have more space to make her products.

loans.use: To buy flour, eggs, butter, cheese, milk, and other things.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy bricks, cement, metal sheets and beams, and to pay labor costs

loans.name: Maria Azucena

texts.es: La señora Maria Azucena, tiene 58 años. La señora se dedica a la venta de ropa usada, ubicada en su casa de habitación en donde llegan varios clientes.  Ella dio inicio con este negocio desde hace 4 años, fue por la necesidad de obtener un ingreso que decide comenzar este medio de vida. Ella solicito este crédito con el objetivo de comprar más mercadería como faldas, tallas extra grandes, vestidos, pantalones y vestidos desea comprar variedad para ofrecer a sus clientes. Su sueño es llegar a comprar un tramo en el mercado, para vender más.
texts.en:
Maria Azucena is 58.  She sells used clothing from her home, where a number of customers come to see her.  She started this business 4 years ago.  She decided to begin this way of making a living, because she needed to earn income. 

She applied for this loan with the aim of buying more merchandise such as skirts, extra-large size clothing, dresses, and pants. She wants to buy a variety of merchandise to offer her customers.  Her dream is to manage to buy a space in the market, in order to sell more.

loans.use: To buy skirts, extra-large size clothing, dresses and pants.

loans.name: Nounagnon D'akassato Group

texts.fr: Le groupe NOUNAGNON D'AKASSATO  est composé de trois personnes qui vivent tous dans le même quartier au Bénin.  C'est la troisième fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de son activité. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Delphine est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Delphine est âgée de 47 ans et est mariée à un commerçant du nom de Christophe. Le couple a deux enfants, tous scolarisés et vivant avec eux. Delphine et son mari assurent ensemble les différentes charges de la famille. Afin de se prendre en charge et d'améliorer son niveau de vie, Delphine exerce depuis vingt ans environs, comme activité la vente de produits divers (conserves, savons, maïs, etc.) à son domicile. Delphine s'approvisionne au Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son revenu, Delphine sollicite, ensemble avec les autres du groupe NOUNAGNON D'AKASSATO, un troisième crédit.
texts.en:
The NOUNAGNON D'AKASSATO  group is made up of three persons who all live in the same neighborhood in Bénin.  It's the third time that this group is requesting a loan from ALIDé, so as to expand their businesses. The representative of the group, Delphine, is the one raising her hand in the photo. 

Delphine,  47, is married to a retailer named Christophe. The couple has two children, both enrolled in school and  living with their parents. Delphine and her husband share in supporting their family. 

In order to provide for herself and improve her standard of living, Delphine has been selling various goods (tinned foods, soap, maize, etc.) for about 20 years, out of her home.  She buys her supplies in Bénin. Wishing to satisfy her clientele and grow her income, Delphine is requesting a third loan, together with the others in the group called NOUNAGNON D'AKASSATO.

loans.use: to buy foodstuffs (maize, canned goods, etc.)

loans.name: Martha Alina

texts.es:
Doña Martha tiene la edad de 42 años, casada, madre de dos hijos, su esposo labora como auditor. Hoy en dia ella labora como analista de credito en una empresa privada.
Tiene su propia casa, que junto a su esposo han construido, para el bien comun de la familia, la cual con ahorros y prestamos en financieras, lo lograron.
Su meta es, poder apoyar  a su mama, ya que esta muy enferma, y la casa la tiene en muy, mal estado, ya que es de madera. El cual podra cambiar techo y levantar paredes de concreto, dando a su mama una mejor vivienda, y mejor higiene. Pues para ella es una inversion ya que es patriminio de la familia.
Para este proyecto no cuenta con todo el capital, y recurre al financiamiento de Afodenic, para hacer la mejora y lograr comenzar la obra de un mejor techo.
texts.en:
Martha is 42 years old. She is married and the mother of two children. Her husband works as an auditor. She works for a private company as a credit analyst.

She has her own house, which she built alongside her husband to benefit the whole family. They managed thanks to savings and loans acquired through financial services companies. Her goal is to support her mother, who is very ill and lives in a house that's in very poor condition as it's made of wood. With the loan she will be able to replace the roof and build concrete walls, which will give her mother better, more hygienic housing. For Martha this is an investment as it is part of the family's assets. 

She doesn't have all the capital she needs for this project and that's why she's requesting the financial support of Afodenic in order to make the improvements and begin the works to improve the roof.

loans.use: to buy building materials to build a concrete house, with a better roof and more hygiene.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy bricks, cement and sand, and to pay labor costs

loans.name: Blanca Rita

texts.es: Blanca Rita tiene 57 años, tiene 4 hijos pero solamente 1 está bajo su cargo Su actividad económica una pulpería. Ha sido con la ayuda de sus hijos que Blanca ha podido establecer este negocio pues ellos la apoyan. Uno de sus mayores desafíos ha sido el mantener este negocio pues tiene cierta competencia.  Es por eso que el financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo para la compra granos básicos, golosinas, refrescos, pan, galletas, enlatados y gaseosas.
texts.en:
Blanca Rita is 57, and has 4 children; only one of whom is her responsibility.  She has a general store.  It's because of her children's help that Blanca has been able to set up this business, since they support her. 

One of her greatest challenges has been keeping this business going, since she has a certain amount of competition. This is why the loan she is applying for is for working capital to buy basic grains, candy, fruit drinks, bread, cookies, canned goods, and soft drinks.

loans.use: To buy basic grains, candy, fruit drinks, bread, cookies, canned goods, and soft drinks.

loans.name: Damaris

texts.es: Damaris, tiene la edad 39 de años, está casada y vive con su esposo, sus suegros y 3 hijos actualmente. Ella lo que va comprar es los insumos para la asistencia de su cafetal. Ella tiene un terreno sembrado y actualmente en producción y quiere mejorarlo para así obtener de él los mejores resultados esta próxima cosecha. Ella quiere generar los mayores ingresos de su cafetal para así tener una mejor calidad de vida y darles el sustento diario a sus hijos. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Ella  no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Damaris is 39 years old. She is married and currently lives with her husband, in-laws and 3 children. 

She plans to buy supplies to support her coffee crops. She has sown some land which is currently in production and wants to improve it so as to obtain the best results possible in the next harvest. She wants to achieve more revenue from her coffee crops to improve her quality of life and support her children. 

This is her first loan with FUDECOSUR. She hadn't received a loan though a state bank before, but FUDECOSUR has given her the loan with much better conditions at a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to support her coffee crops.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy bricks, cement, and sheet metal roofing materials and to pay to have the work done

loans.name: Trinite Group

texts.fr: TRINITE est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres résident dans le même quartier au Bénin. La représentante du groupe, Akuta Isabelle (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 37 ans et est mariée à un policier du nom de Joseph. Le couple a deux enfants, tous scolarisés, et à leur charge. Akuta Isabelle vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple subvient ensemble aux divers besoins du ménage. Akuta Isabelle est allée à l'école. Pour se prendre en charge et assurer les besoins de ses enfants, Akuta Isabelle mène comme activité depuis dix huit ans, la vente de tissus par le système de livraison. Akuta Isabelle achète ses produits au Bénin. C’est la deuxième fois que Akuta Isabelle sollicite un crédit auprès de ALIDé, crédit qui permettra certainement à Akuta Isabelle et aux autres membres du groupe TRINITE, d’accroître leur stock de produits et de mieux répondre aux exigences de leur clientèle.
texts.en: TRINITE (TRINITY) is a group of three people, who reside in the same district in Bénin. The leader of the group, Akuta Isabelle (whose hand is raised in the photo), is 37 years old and is married to a policeman named Joseph. The couple has two children, both in school, and in their care. Akuta Isabelle lives together with her husband and their children. The couple provides for the needs of the household together. Akuta Isabelle went to school. In order to support her children and to ensure that their needs are met, Akuta Isabelle has carried out her business for 18 years, the sale of fabric using a delivery system. Akuta Isabelle buys her products in Bénin. It is the second time that Akuta Isabelle has asked for a loan from ALIDé, the loan is certain to allow Akuta Isabelle and the other members of the TRINITE (TRINITY) group to increase their stock of products and to better respond to the needs of their customers.

loans.use: To buy fabric

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cement, zinc, sand, and purlins.

loans.name: Isolda Elena

texts.es: Isolda Elena, se dedica a la venta de mercadería en general. Esta no es la primera vez que ella tiene experiencia con financiamientos. El empeño y dedicación que brinda a sus clientes es algo que les llama la atención. Debido a esto solicita el crédito con el fin de comprar los encargos que tiene pendiente como sabanas, toalla, perfumes, calzado, cremas entre otros. A pesar de que cada día tiene que hablar con diferentes personas ella siempre tiene su carisma que atrae.
texts.en: Isolda Elena sells general merchandise. This is not her first experience with loans. The commitment and dedication that she provides her customers is something that catches their attention. Because of this, she is requesting a loan in order to purchase merchandise for the orders she has pending, such as sheets, towels, perfumes, shoes and creams, among other merchandise. Despite having to talk to different people every day, she always has her charisma, which attracts people.

loans.use: to buy sheets, towels, perfumes, shoes, creams and other merchandise

loans.name: Janny Marleny

texts.es:
Janny de 27 años, vive con su esposo e hijos en su casa propia, cuenta con servicio sólo de luz, ubicada en la zona rural del distrito de Tambogrande que pertenece al departamento de Piura.  Zona de alta actividad agrícola, ganadería y artesanía.

Desde hace unos años Janny se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza por catálogo, su negocio lo tiene en su domicilio, cuenta con su propia clientela, con los ingresos que obtenga en ambas actividades podrá solventar sus necesidades familiares.

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1000 nuevos soles para comprar más productos de belleza y aves de corral porque quiere iniciar en otro negocio, para ofrecerlos a sus clientes y así podrá obtener mayores ganancias para tener una mejor calidad de vida. Janny es una mujer trabajadora y una madre que siempre trata que su familia salga adelante a pesar de las dificultades que a veces se presentan en la vida.
texts.en:
Janny is 27 years old and lives with her husband and children in their own house, where the only service they have is lights. It is located in a rural zone in the district of Tambogrande, which belongs to the department of Piura. This is a zone where the main activities are agriculture, livestock, and arts.

Since several years ago, Janny has been selling beauty products by catalog. She runs her business in her home and has her own customer base. With the income she earns, she is able to meet her family's needs.

She has requested a loan of 1,000 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa in order to buy more beauty products, as well as poultry birds.  She would like to start another business to offer her customers and to gain more income, so that she can have a better quality of life. Janny is a hard-working woman and a mother who is always trying to get her family ahead, despite the difficulties that life sometimes presents.

loans.use: to buy poultry birds and more beauty products

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es:
Juan de 32 años de edad, vive en casa de sus padres con su familia, la cual cuenta con servicios de agua y luz, ubicada en el distrito de Oyotún que pertenece a la provincia de Chiclayo.   Esta zona se dedica a la agricultura y ganadería.

Juan desde hace algunos años se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales de corral (cerdos y gallinas), sus corrales se encuentra en la parte posterior de su casa, los cuales son apropiados y amplios, los alimenta con comida balanceada y granos naturales para que sus animales lleguen a tener un crecimiento óptimo para poderlos ofrecer en los diferentes mercados de la zona y así obtenga buenas ganancias para solventar sus gastos familiares.

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1500 nuevos soles  para la compra de más animales y su respectiva comida, con las ganancias que obtenga con la venta de sus animales podrá cubrir su crédito como tener una mejor calidad de vida.  Juan es una persona que con esfuerzo y mucho empeño a sabido salir adelante junto con esposa e hijos.
texts.en:
32-year-old Juan lives in his parent's home with his family.  The house has water and electricity, and is located in Oyotún district, in Chiclayo province.  The people in this area farm and raise livestock.

Juan has been raising and selling farmyard animals (pigs and hens) for some years.  His pens are located behind his home.  They are suitable and spacious.  He feeds his animals balanced feed and natural grains so that they reach an optimal level of growth.  This means he can sell them in the different markets in his area and make good profits with which to cover his family expenses.

Juan has requested a loan for 1,500 soles from Edpyme Alternativa to buy more animals and their respective feed.  He will use the profits that he makes from selling his animals to repay his loan and enjoy a better quality of life.  Juan is a person who, through hard work and a lot of determination, has known how to get ahead in life together with his wife and children.

loans.use: to buy more animals and their respective feed

loans.name: Orlando

texts.es: Orlando, tiene la edad de 50 años, está casado y vive con su esposa y 2 hijos que son su mayor prioridad. El con el crédito va comprar los insumos del almacigo y realizar el pago de mano de obra por el mantenimiento del almacigo. El tiene sembrado un almacigo de café para su posterior venta en el mercado de la localidad y a productores que quieran aumentar el tamaño de su cafetal. el pretende con esto darle a su almacigo los mejores cuidados para así vender buena calidad y generar la mayor cantidad de ganancias para el bienestar de su familia. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El  no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Orlando is 50 years old, married, and lives with his wife and two children who are his main priority.  With this loan, he will buy supplies for a seedbed and pay laborers to maintain the seedbed.  He has sown a bed with coffee which he will later sell in the town market and to producers who want to increase the size of their coffee plantations.  Orlando plans to give his seedbed the very best care so that he can sell good-quality products and make a lot of profits to provide for his family's well-being.

This is the first loan that Orlando has received from FUDECOSUR.  He hasn't taken out previous loans with state banks but FUDECOSUR have offered him this loan with better terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy seedbed supplies.

loans.name: Eugenio

texts.es:
Eugenio de 46 años de edad, vive con su esposa e hijos en su casa propia, la cual no cuenta con servicios básicos, ubicada en la zona rural del distrito de Santo Domingo que pertenece al departamento de Cajamarca. Zona que se caracteriza por la actividad agrícola, ganadera y turismo.

La actividad que desarrolla Eugenio es la agricultura, cuenta con sus propias tierras de cultivo donde siembra caña de azúcar, es un producto que se consume diariamente, una vez que realiza su cosecha su producto los ofrece a los diferentes mercados de la zona donde vive  y así puede obtener ingresos para cubrir sus gastos familiares.  También vende aguardiente (bebida que se extrae de la caña de azúcar), luego la vende a los pobladores de la misma zona y así obtiene otro ingreso para su casa.

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa mediante Capital Semilla de 2000 nuevos soles para comprar fertilizantes para mejorar sus tierras y de aguardiente para seguir comercializandolo a los pobladores, con la finalidad de tener una buena ganancia y así mejorar su calidad de vida. Eugenio es una persona que se preocupa por que su negocio crezca para que tenga algunas comodidades y seguir apoyando a su familia en los gastos diarios.
texts.en:
Eugenio is 46, and lives with his wife and children in their own home, which does not have basic services. It is located in the rural area of the Santo Domingo district, which is part of Cajamarca department. This area is known for farming, livestock raising and tourism.

Eugenio is a farmer.  He has his own land, where he grows sugar cane, a product that is consumed every day.  Once he harvests his crop, he sells it at the different markets in the area where he lives; in this way he can earn income to cover his family's expenses.  He also sells aguardiente (a drink extracted from sugar cane), to people in the same area, and so earns other income for his household. 

He has applied to Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 2000 nuevos soles through the Capital Semilla (Seed Money) program, in order to buy fertilizers to improve his land and aguardiente to keep selling to local people.  His aim is to earn a good profit, and thereby improve his quality of life. Eugenio is a person who is concerned about making his business grow, so that he can have a few home comforts and keep supporting his family with their daily expenses.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers to improve his land, and aguardiente (drink made from sugar cane) to sell.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is a 28 year old farmer from the village Sakhalvasho, Adjara Region. He is unmarried and lives with his parents – 57 year old father and 54 year old mother. His father works as a worker-constructor locally and his mother is a housewife. 

Daniel is leading the agricultural business of the family. They grow tangerines on the families own 0.3 hectare land. Also they have a milk cow. Daniel’s mother produces cheese from the milk and sells it at a local open market. Daniel also has a small bee-keeping farm with 4 beehives and bee-colonies. He gets on average 60 liters of honey annually, and sells it locally. 

Daniel requested credit for expansion of the bee-keeping business. He will purchase 5 - 6 additional beehives and bee-colonies and this will increase the amount of harvested honey by 125 – 150%. It will significantly increase the income of the family and improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase 5 - 6 beehives and bee-colonies

loans.name: Liz Shirley

texts.es:
Liz es madre de familia de 34 años de edad, vive en casa de su hermana junto con sus hijos, cuenta con los servicios de agua y luz, ubicada en la zona urbana del distrito de Cayaltí que pertenece a la provincia de Chiclayo.  Esta zona se caracteriza por la actividad agrícola y ganadera.

Desde hace algunos años aproximadamente Liz se ha dedicado a la venta de abarrotes (todo tipo de productos que se utilizan diariamente como: leche, arroz, aceite, azúcar, papel higiénico, atún, huevos,otros), menestras, cereales  y bebidas, su negocio lo ha colocado en un puesto en el mercado de la zona donde vive, con las ganancias por la venta de sus productos  trata de cubrir  todos sus gastos familiares.

Para poder  implementar su negocio a solicitado un crédito a Edpyme Alternativa  de 2000 nuevos soles para comprar más mercadería, con el único ideal de que su negocio se amplie y tenga más productos para ofrecerles a sus clientes;  con el dinero que gane cubrirá su préstamo y sus obligaciones de su hogar.  Liz es una persona dedicada y trabajadora que se preocupa por brindarles  más comodidades a sus hijos y también otras oportunidades académicas.
texts.en:
Liz is a 34 year-old mother who lives in a house with her sister and her children.  The house has water and electrical service, and is located in an urban area in the Cayali district in the province of Chiclayo.  This area is known for its agriculture and livestock production.

For a number of years, Liz has been selling groceries (all types of everyday consumer goods such as: milk, rice, cooking oil, sugar, toilet paper, tuna, eggs and other products), beans, cereals and drinks.  Her business is located in a stall in the market in her neighborhood.  With the earnings she gets from the sale of these products, she tries to cover all of her family's expenses.

In order to stock up her business she is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa for 2,000 Peruvian soles to buy more merchandise.  She will use the loan for the sole purpose of expanding her business so that she can have more products to offer to her customers.  With the money she earns, she will pay off the loan and pay for the household expenses.  Liz is a dedicated and hardworking person who is concerned with providing more comforts and academic opportunities for her children.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise to stock up her business

loans.name: Janina De Los Angeles

texts.es:
